Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort & a Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: J G
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego in early April for our Spring Break vacation and we chose to stay at Inn at the Park for six nights. We were so glad that we stayed there! The resort in undergoing renovations, and we were honestly a little worried about this when we booked our stay because we thought that it would be noisy and chaotic as a result, but just the opposite was true. We were given a corner room on the fourth floor and it was very quiet and peaceful there. Our room was not one of the renovated rooms, but this didn't matter to us because it was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. We had a full kitchen (with stove, fridge, microwave, coffeemaker, dishes, glasses & silverware), two queen beds, a large changing room area, and bathroom. There is no A/C, but the temperature was very pleasant and it was quite nice to have the windows open. There is also a ceiling fan over the beds and an extra room fan if you need it (we didn't). The hotel offers a continental breakfast on the top floor with both indoor and outdoor seating, and not to mention the beautiful view. Breakfast consisted of bagels (with toppings of cream cheese, peanut butter, butter, or jelly), English muffins, various pastries, fresh fruit (bananas, melons, etc.) vanilla & strawberry yogurt, cereals, granola, hard-boiled eggs, juices, coffee, hot chocolate, and more. Our 11 year-old loved the bagels and hard-boiled eggs. Breakfast items were always fresh and satisfying. Each and every staff member we encountered was friendly, courteous, helpful, and always had smiles on their faces. This applies to everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff to the valets. We definitely felt welcomed. The hotel offers valet parking for $15 per day, but we did not need to use it because street parking was always available at any time of the day or night. We were able to park right in front of the entrance to the hotel most of the nights we stayed there. The neighborhood is safe and we felt comfortable there. Inn at the Park is in a great location. It is literally across the street from Balboa Park and we walked there in a matter of minutes. You can catch the park trolley near 6th street and you are on your way! The hotel is conveniently close to downtown and is just a few miles from the major attractions (USS Midway, Maritime Museum, Petco Field, lots of restaurants, to name a few). It is also just a few convenient miles away from the San Diego Airport and the various rental car companies. We would definitely stay again at Inn at the Park!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel but came with some problems”
Reviews.Author: amberLeiv
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice, both times I was staying for comic con. The first time I stayed here was July 2010 for a single night. Comic con had just finished but we were looking to spend another night in san diego so we called up this hotel and got a room easily. Our first stay was very nice, got a large room with a king size bed, kitchen/dining area, huge closet and nice sized bathroom. The second time we stayed was July 2011 and this time I booked a year in advance for a king size room. When we arrived we found out they had put us in a room that felt smaller than our first one and had a queen size bed. Now, I had paid for a king size room and was given a queen size room so I went to the front desk and asked if they could give us a king sized room, like we asked for, or compensate us some of the money, since queen sized rooms are listed at lower prices than kings. The woman at the front desk said she had no authority to refund us and that all the rooms were booked and to come back when the manager was there. Well...I was never able to catch up to the manager apparently, as every time I went to the desk the person working had no authority. I found that incredibly irritating...but oh well. With all other matters the staff was very helpful and kind. We were on the first floor which was nice so we didn't have to lug our suitcases up stairs or in the elevator that seemed to keep breaking down. The room was on the smaller side but we got used to it, it did have a kitchen and nice bathroom with a very deep tub. I loved the location with the park right across the street and within walking distance to many attractions and a lot of nice restaurants. The valet was also very friendly and always got our car to us quickly. All in all it is a very nice hotel, very comfortable, nice decor and can make you feel at home. BUT because they were unable to honor my year in advance booking for a king size room and unable to reimburse me I probably won't be coming back. I would recommend the hotel for other people when they're coming at a time of year that isn't as busy as comic con. For myself though I will be exploring other hotel options for this July.

Reviews.Title: “Location, caring staff, historic atmosphere, good food.”
Reviews.Author: AB_Travel
Reviews.Content: Yes, the construction is real and present. Ignore it as much as possible and this is a good place to stay. One half of the the hotel is walled off and under construction. There is a six-storey building being built on the south side of the hotel. If you don't mind the daytime noise because you will be out exploring the city, get a room on the south side (even numbers) and the sunshine warms your room. If the noise bothers you, get a room on the north side (odd numbers). This is such a great, old hotel. Balboa Park is right across the street. Beds are very comfortable. Breakfast (not fancy; just simple food) on the roof is fabulous - food and view. The restaurant piano bar in the basement is excellent - food, service and music. The staff are wonderful. They do everything within their power to minimize the inconvenience of the renos. They have a tough job right now - trying to make everyone happy with so much going on. Be kind to them. We had such fun and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “At the moment, not recommended..”
Reviews.Author: UrlaubundReise
Reviews.Content: The hotel could be nice(big rooms, good mattress), if it was not for the construction noise during weekdays on the southern side (the manager has time to answer every comment here online but seems unable to warn guests of this noise), the thin windows which let yo hear every car on the street, the average motel-style breakfast in only a small part of the rooftop restaurants, the extra parking fee of 15 $, the non-existent air condition or heating (it was chilly in the room) and the terrace without sun beds. So, if you are not dependent of the location, not many reasons to stay here these days, or months..

Reviews.Title: “Family Get Away”
Reviews.Author: LCastilloCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We felt like we stayed in a fancy hotel with the valet parking. Customer service was great. We had only been in the room for about 10 minutes when they called to make sure we had settled in ok and if we needed anything. It's also close to restarants and shopping. Also about a mile away from the San Diego Zoo. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of remodeling”
Reviews.Author: Peacesnplaysez
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 2 others last weekedn. great access - walking distance (about 2 blocks) to a shuttle to the Museums and zoo at Balboa Park. You are on the edge of the park for pleasant walks. The Hillcrest distance is in walking distance too for good restaurants. However, due to renovations, which we didn't know about because we didn't scrutinize the website, the place is in a mess right now, with sections blocked off, plastic hanging, no "forgot it" amenities available and increased noise. All tolerable except for the fact that the second morning of our stay - when we were finally allowed to eat breakfast on the rooftop, we were told that we had to join others at tables for 6 (only 4 were set up) or cram the 3 of us onto a tiny elevated cocktail table. All that would have been tolerable, had they not had all the other tables set up in the beautiful rooptop, stained glass windows etc. restaurant, which they were only allowing people to use part of! I thought it was extremely rude to deny guests a comfortable, private breakfast table when they were already enduring the mess of the re-model. After complaint on my part , we were give 1 nights free valet parking (A $15 value and there is plenty of free parking available on the street). Then they finally gifted us a "20% off coupon for our next stay" and only at my insistence gave each in the party a coupon. Also, breakfast service included dirty plates and 1 salt and pepper shaker that had to be shared by the entire room! We did see a newly remodeled room and none of us were big fans of the somewhat kitchy lavendar and silver color theme. They are trying to give a grand old lady of a hotel a makeover that is age inappropriate. The rooms are spacious and its nice to have a table and chairs in the kitchen. The light over the dressing table didn't work and we were told it couldn't be repaired and a request for wineglasses was ignored. Very comfortable beds and windows that actually opened were great.

Reviews.Title: “Will Miss the 30's-40's Style”
Reviews.Author: bzv
Reviews.Content: We just returned from San Diego after staying for 4 days at the Inn at the Park (formerly Park Avenue Suites). I was hesitant because of the mixed reviews, but after stepping through the door of our King Bed Suite, Room 608, I was entranced. The room had not been remodeled yet, and I was so very glad to stay before the historical aspects are forever removed. I LOVED all the 80+ year old built-in shelving in the dressing room, and the kitchen is a history buff's dream: etched glass cupboard doors, a built-in "pantry" cupboard with grates for air flow, and, my favorite--an antique built-in Kelvinator mini-fridge (non-working). See my posted picture. The bathtub was huge and deep with a rainfall showerhead; the bed was comfortable (small square pillows were not). Our room was right off the elevator and across from the bottom of the (steep) stairs to the morning continental breakfast on the 7th floor, and although there was a party upstairs on the 1st night of our stay, the only time we could hear anything was when the people were leaving down the stairs. If you are a ghost hunter (this place appears to ooze with spirits), do not mind that the lack of air conditioning (we found it non-necessary surprisingly), like a 1930-40's atmosphere, and want to be within walking distance of Balboa Park and Hillcrest (a tad further but walkable), then Inn at the Park is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the Park San Diego”
Reviews.Author: betty707
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Inn at the Park. The location was great. We had a rental car, but fount the Tram, which stopped 2 (short) blocks away, was better they dealing with the car. The tram took us to all the museums in Balboa Park. We used the Tram several times during the trip. The staff at the hotel were wonderful and the resturant in the lower level was very good and convient. The continental breakfast always had frest fruit, yogurt, cottage cheese and the regular things. The hotel is old (1926), and is being renovated. It was very reasonable,but that might change. The only down side was the bed. It was very hard. I hope they get new ones as I would definitely return. I loved San Diego, La Jolla, The Midway, Balboa Park and the Zoo. Could have stayed more that a week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old time feeling”
Reviews.Author: Mka_Finland
Reviews.Content: -Best thing in the hotel is that it takes you back to a feeling of early 19th century -Big minus is that wireless in the room was not working for most parts in the rooms - even though they adverticed that as a complimentary. One needed to go to a lobby many times to use the internet -Good location for seeing Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, Hillcrest and Museum area by walking

Reviews.Title: “My affection for this place is guarded”
Reviews.Author: LightPro
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at "The Inn" (fka "Park Manor Hotel") over 25 times since the mid '90s. So I was a little worried when I heard this beloved property was recently taken over by a company better known for time shares. The ongoing renovation of rooms in the western part of the hotel did not affect my stay (although I visted on a weekend and work was suspended). The unrenovated rooms still hold their slightly tattered charm, although the rooms are very large, clean and comfortable. All suites include a funtional kitchen. WiFi was nonexistent, except in the lobby and restaurant areas. New valet parking of $15/day forces you onto street parking if you don't want to pay. Still, the location and friendly service is preserved as I recognized many long-term employees during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “True Hospitality !”
Reviews.Author: Stuart L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 nights over Xmas and New Year and we loved this hotel. By far the greatest asset are the staff. From the moment Kathlyn checked us in with the brightest, cheeriest smile I knew we were going to enjoy our stay. Don't let the reviews about it being dated put you off, we're from England and we have hotels much older than this. They were re-modelling the hotel when we were there (but you couldn't hear any noise, it was discretly happening behind a fake wall) and the investment in the product will compliment the great staff here. Aldy, Robin & Paul on the front desk were just the most helpful and courteous front desk team I have ever experienced, nothing was too much trouble. Noah in the restaurant was a very nice guy who chatted to us frequently making us feel at home. On New Years Eve they even placed a complimentary bottle of Champagne in our room to celebrate the festivities, such a thoughtful touch ! The valet parking guys were so polite and even helped us find a cab when we needed one. All in all, one of the best hotel stays I have ever experienced. Yes there are swankier hotels downtown, but you can't beat the genuine hospitality offered here. Congratulations to the management, you have a great team ! We can't wait to come back !

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GioAndJen
Reviews.Content: Although the style and decor is very dated, our room was clean & comfortable. The staff were friendly, and the free breakfast consisted of a wide range of choices. I did notice that the room didn't seem to have A/C. It was cool out the day we were in San Diego, but I don't think I would be comfortable staying there if it was hot. For the price, I would consider staying there again depending on the season.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find next to Balboa Park”
Reviews.Author: SFTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the day after Thanksgiving and really enjoyed it. The rooms are like small apartments and I am sure at one time they may have been. Our room faced the street across from the Balboa Park and its great to get up in the morning and take a walk. On Friday night there was a fun event at the top of the Park and in the morning they use that room for breakfast. There are some great views of the city by walking around up there. The hotel is convenient not only for the park but to the Hillcrest area a few blocks to the north. The front desk was very freindly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My own little San Diego apartment”
Reviews.Author: Atomique
Reviews.Content: I had to be in San Diego for business for a while and wanted something different. Some one who had worked at the theater in town recommended this hotel. They were so right in doing so I could kiss 'em. Having lived all over the country, in various pre-war apartments and condos, this is perfect for me. Give me hardwoods and vintage cabinetry! I've been to San Diego many times but never to this neighborhood. It's a great little area and quite convenient. Easy to get to from the airport. Doesn't look like much from the outside. Love that its across the street from a park, not only a nice view but you're can always go walking, or take a picnic or join the yoga class I seen one day. There was a line to check in so I browsed the very nice lobby filled with European antiques. When I arrived in my room I squealed that it feels like home. Very nice, big, comfy inviting room. Full kitchen with dining room. Lots of windows. There was no air conditioning in my room but you didn't need it. There was a bit of street noise, which I'm used to and doesn't bother me. Bed was clean and comfy. Decent amount of channels to watch when you want to veg. Bathroom was clean and big. The staff was quirky and very helpful. Really a great little hotel. Especially great for extended stays or people who like to cook.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend at Grandmas apartment”
Reviews.Author: TSExpert
Reviews.Content: This place is OK, and its' location is excellent being next to the park and easy to find in the Hilltop area. Rooms are in need of a facelift, but Shell, the new owners are promising that. Miss not having a gym or a pool, or a hot tub. Our room was a King sudio, nice size for a hotel room, and it had a kichenette with minimal cookware (forget about hotpads, dish cloths, or even paper towels). The microwave was low-tech, and we had to cart it to another room to plug it it, as it had a polarized plug, and they are not many so-equiped recepticles. Most of the eletrical stuff is pretty beat up, and the door lock is a little flimsy. For being a littl worn, the room was really clean with one exception, the ceiling fan is caked with dirt. I would have appreciated a little heat but the boiler was not on, and none of the windows closed tight. Still the place has some charm, and the resturant food and breakfast buffet are really good. Hopefully Shell will do there usual fine job of restoration in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “First class-at the tip of Balboa Park”
Reviews.Author: oldbajalady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property eleven times over the past eleven years. I always book the Presidential Suite- two lovely bedrooms, large living room and dining room with a kitchen. We celebrate the Susan G Komen Race for the Cure in Nov each year and this accommodation gives my team a place to meet the evening before the Race. It is one block from Race start. there is a fantastic restaurant and piano bar on property as well. The staff is delightful and although recently purchased by Shell Hospitality Group it is our sincere hope that they upgrade without taking away its wonderful Old World feel.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Tokenblkguy78
Reviews.Content: San Diego's best Kept Secret So my Fiancé and I are getting married in Coronado next year and we came down here for her birthday back In august to check out venues and get wedding things organized. I spend a good part of the day trying to find a good hotel for good value using a plethora of travel site. I ran across this hotel since I filtered valet and parking for less than $30( it seems the norm in SD is having $35-60 a night valet). Even for hotels who have outside parking lots.. So after a long exhausting search I found this place. It seemed like a great place from the reviews I read. Since we were going to be there 4 nights I went to the property website and they actually had a special stay 4 nights and get the 4th one for free. So it came out to about $120 bucks a night, A steal for this area. We got to the hotel and were greeting by a very professional valet and front desk representative. The rooms are very vintage and swanky. We are simple people and don’t need the most lavish of amenities and we actually appreciated the old school feel of the rooms, and bathrooms. The beds were amazing (and huge, I'm 6'3 230 Plus) and after all the running around we did in the city for 4 days we had no problems passing out. We had a king size suite on the second floor facing the valet parking lot. Noise levels at night were fine and we slept with the windows open to let the cool breeze in the room. We complimentary breakfast in the morning is on top of the restaurant with breath taking views of balboa park and you can see clear into the city, airport, and Coronado on a clear day. We utilized this pretty much every morning and the menu'd food was very filling especially for touristy duty. Very good selection for the price. The restaurant bar and lounge is great, Friday and weekend nights they have a Piano playing and someone singing, or someone can take a stab at karaoke. The food was amazing as well. We decided to head here toward the tail end of the trip as we were tired and just wanted to wind down with some wine and good company. I think what we loved the most about the hotel was the location to everything and how quiet it was around the hotel. It was literally no more than a 10 min cab ride to anywhere of interest in the Gaslamp district. We had a rental car but we used cabs more than anything. I think we spend on average 25 bucks roundtrip to get to all the restaurants/ bars etc for the nights we met up with friends etc. Living in Sacramento and frequenting SF/ Bay Area regularly we love cabs especially with parking and the frustrations with that. We loved the Inn At the Park so Much we decided to have the wedding party and close family stay here during the wedding. With the roomy 2 bedrooms suites with kitchenettes we figured this would be a great place for family to stay for 4 days plus since if they decide to not eat out they can cook foods and etc. We also will stay here whenever we come to San Diego. Like I said we have stayed at 5 star hotels, the W's, etc and we don’t always get that feel that they are happy you are here, we feel like cattle get you in and get you out. Here we actually felt like we were welcomed and they didn’t want us to leave. As some of the other reviews have mentioned this hotel isn’t for everyone, but I think a vast majority of people will love this place once you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Character”
Reviews.Author: judysj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in late October 2011 while in town for a friend's birthday bash and this is the nearest hotel to our friend's house. It was perfect for our needs and the 1920s ambience of the hotel is charming. The staff, from the valet to the front desk employees, were all professional, friendly and service-oriented. Our room (606) included a king bed (with two night stands and reading lights), a sitting area (with oversized wing chairs, an ottoman and side tables), a kitchen (with all the basics plus a table and chairs), dressing area (walk-in closet, dressing table with mirror, shelves, drawers, etc.) and bathroom (shower/tub combination). The closet included a fan (no A/C here) that you could bring out if it was a warm day/evening. The included continental breakfast featured fresh fruit, yogurt, good-quality coffee, breads, pastries, etc. This hotel was a good value, with excellent service and served our needs. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Time Charm”
Reviews.Author: tomgray347
Reviews.Content: This place had an old timey aesthetic that seemed more kooky and eccentric when contrasted to the sleek restaurants and shops in the surrounding neighborhood. My wife was in town for work, and so I mooched for a couple of weekend long visits. Her room came with a small kitchen and was, basically, a studio apartment. I recommend taking advantage of the complimentary breakfast spread served at the rooftop dining room. There is all varieties of breakfast food up there, short of meat. And the coffee is strong.

Reviews.Title: “An old-fashioned gem”
Reviews.Author: frankwil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real delight: attractive and convenient location by Balboa Park, excellent friendly service, low prices and enormous rooms. The King suite is palatial, with a big bedroom (sofa and easy chairs), kitchen and dining area and enough storage space to stay for the whole season. Tremendously good value. I've been staying here for ten years or more and recommend it highly. You even get a free continental breakfast on the top floor with spectacular views in all directions.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation but loved it anyway!”
Reviews.Author: sk602
Reviews.Content: We were able to upgrade to a 1 bedroom with balcony and I am so happy we did. Rooms were very large except for a small galley kitchen. We loved sitting on our balcony enjoying the cool breezes of San Diego. We kept all of our windows and balcony doors open without any problems. There was construction going on next door but not enough to interrupt our sleep. Gabriel, one of the housekeepers, went out of his way to accomodate requests. The place has recently been bought by Shell Vacations, a timeshare developer, who plans to rennovate. We are excited to return and see some of the changes but would return even if the room was the same.

Reviews.Title: “this may be your last chance”
Reviews.Author: WoodRich
Reviews.Content: we have been going to the Park Manor for the last ten years. the last three years it has been a group of eight to ten of us. we love the old feel of the hotel and enjoy the roomy spaces. Jersey in the bar, the entertainment nightly, and frank in the dining room left us with NO reason to ever leave the hotel. housekeeping and front desk are more than great. But things are to change @ the park! and it will be for the best! Shell vacations will pour new money and life into this dear old friend of mine and have assured me to keep her as regal as ever. I did get a peek at a new room and all I could say is WOW ! I hope for ten more years.

Reviews.Title: “A sadder by wiser place for me”
Reviews.Author: Robert_in_Velez
Reviews.Content: I saw a few negative comments on this place. I'll tell you what their problem is: Those people were expecting a new glitzy hotel. THIS PLACE IS NOT. It's a charming older hotel in the process of a few renovations. It is convenient to Balboa Park and restaurants. It is adjacent to the Hillcrest District. We even went there with our bicycles, and they let us bring them to our room for the night. Incredibly accommodating staff and very friendly. One thing they don't make really clear though, is that you CAN park on the street for free, rather than using their rather expensive valet parking. We drove there, and parked on the street for six days without a problem. You MUST move your car at least every 48 hours, or you will be towed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - Amateurish Staff”
Reviews.Author: Susan1230
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location across from the park and the rooms are large. While old, the furnishings are comfortable. There is a full kitchen and the beds are good. There is no pool or public area to use except a smoking patio downstairs. There is a really nice deck on the roof where they serve breakfast and lunch, but don't try to go to the top deck in the evening as the staff will tell you five different reasons why you are not allowed to go there including that it is a safety concern. You can go to the roof patio on Friday nights for happy hour or you can just go up there on other nights without telling any of the staff. The chef was rooftop security. The room service staff person did not bring condiments, bread, butter, salt, pepper or a tray (and they take the serving cart with them). The bellman is the valet. The front desk staff people are nice but they have no authority to solve problems and the manager thinks they need to work on communication. Stay here for close to the park room. Don't expect fancy or any hotel services except continental breakfast. Skip room service and SNEAK if you’re going to do a candlelight dinner on the back patio on the roof for your husband.

Reviews.Title: “Retro but not necessarily charming”
Reviews.Author: rjuliansf
Reviews.Content: This great 1920s building across the street from Balboa Park needs a complete remodel back to the studs. Formerly apartments, the rooms are little changed since they were rental units. Plumbing, electrical, HVAC, and windows all need to be replaced. The hotel has no air conditioning, but it's rarely needed in San Diego. Don't spend Friday night on the sixth floor because that night the rooftop bar (on 7) is a crush of locals for the 5 p.m to 10 p.m. happy hour. The self-service elevator, which is always slow, is assigned an operator for that evening to transport the crowd up and down all night. I actually found the place charming because it precisely resembles the many 1920s apartment buildings I remember fondly from my 30 years in San Francisco. It even smells like those buildings. The rates are reasonable and the linens are fresh, but you have to pay $15 per day for valet parking, plus tax. Decent continental breakfast included with room rate and the coffee is good. I might stay there again, but probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Location superb, good value. no a\c.”
Reviews.Author: BC_HowLin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights during the first week of July. AS has been described before, this is an old apatment building renovated to hotel suites. In general we were very pleased with the hotel and will probably consider again on future visits. Very nice complimentary breakfast - clean room and very good staff. However, to be fair, these are some of the 'negatives'. - no a/c: Only ceiling fans which would suffice probably for 8 months of the year, but July through October some might find the rooms a little uncomfortable. - parking: the hotel recently changed ownership and the once-free parking is now valet parking only at $15/day I believe. - elavator small and extremely slow; so much so, that for morning breakfast we walked up from the 4th floor as it was much quicker. All-in-all though, as previously stated, we would still consider for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: PrintDevil
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, rooms are incredibly spacious with kitchenettes, nice beds, and vintage bathrooms. Plenty of hot water, a great friday evening cocktail hour on the roof, and easy parking and close to Hillcrest make it near-ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jlynn1123
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego and my mother stayed here in June, this hotel is beautiful! It's so elegantly decorted but in an antique way. The ceiling in the lobby is beautiful and apparently the new owners surprisingly uncovered it during renovations. Anyway, when we were there, they were were still renovating and I think we had a room that was not yet renovated but it massive. A huge king bed, sofa, armoire, vanity desk, kitchen - stove, refridgerator and the necessary kitchenware. I loved all the antique furniture, so nice to look at and change from standard hotel decor. I think the rate was $99/night which was a steal! Everyone who worked here was very nice and welcoming. We received a discount for the restaurant on the roof, living in San Diego it was so nice to find a good restaurant so close to home that I had no idea about. There was a nice view and we received great food and great service. They offer free parking and it's within walking distance to Balboa Park and a short cab ride to Downtown and the airport. I would, and have, recommended this to friends looking for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: timinla
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom suite for July 16th, 2011. We arrived around noontime and were told our room wouldn't be ready till 3pm. Upon return, we checked in with the fornt desk and arrived at the "Bolboa Room" #202, and walked in to find a dirty filthy wall to wall carpet in the bedroom, which was appointed with a mismatch of bad 70's furniture, 20's dresser, a tv so old it should have donated to the Smithsonian, a bathroom that hadn't seen a renovation since it's birth in 1926, EEK!!!, and even worse, our suite had an ajoining room that looked like they had just broken down a conference, with stacks of chairs, a PODIUM, as if I was going be lecturing? and not a stick of furniture you would expect to see in your living room. We had thought we would have friends by for a drink, but that was unlikely...as Betty Davis once said "WHAT A DUMP" There was no one there of importance who could address this problem, so I called when we arrived home to LA, and left a message for the General Manager, but alas, like the crappy room they rent out as a suite, this numbnuts General Manager, and I use that term loosely, has yet to call me back(it's been over 7 days)..DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND RUN FAR FAR AWAY...FIND A REPUTABLE HOTEL WITH A PROFESSIONAL STAFF..THIS ONE BITES THE BIG ONE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old and stinky”
Reviews.Author: esc4eve
Reviews.Content: We are getting married in November at Balboa Park. We'd been telling all of our guests that this was the best and closest property to the venue. My soon to be Mother-in-Law booked a room based on the pictures on the website and the description. She was in town, so we naturally wanted to go and check out the hotel in person. Sadly there were no rooms that looked like the one's shown on the website. Not only that, but it seemed run down and smelled like it had water damage. Too bad :-(

Reviews.Title: “absolutely horrible!”
Reviews.Author: SRK_11
Reviews.Content: Looking forward to touring the sites of SanDiego after my business conference ended at a different facility, I moved to this more central location. The place is stinky, moldy, old - room size cannot make up for that. Although a 'non smoking' hotel my room, closet area in particular, wreaked of smoke. The bathroom made me actually retch. I could not stay and actually forfeited a night's cost and went and stayed elsewhere - I am not a frivilous person so this was a significant decision for me to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: gvwatts
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at this property, it was still known as the Park Manor Suites. I was part of a convention and this was the second time that we had chosen this establishment because of the very positive experience that we had on our first gathering in 2010. This hotel has an excellent location in the Hillcrest neighborhood in San Diego, close to local shopping haunts, coffee shops and restaurants. It is in close proximity to the San Diego Zoo; this was an important factor in our choice of accommodation because our main convention activities involved visits to the zoo. The service and amenities at this property exceeded our expectations. The food in the street level restaurant was delicious and service was very attentive without being pushy. The menu was very creative and food presentation was impressive. Breakfast was served in the penthouse which afforded great views of San Diego - a lovely way to start the day. The kitchen also catered our convention banquet; the chef designed a special 3-course menu for a very reasonable cost and, again, the quality was tops. The rooms have that great old-world ambiance to match the history of the building - high ceilings, pristine, white bedding, dressing tables, and kitchen facilities provided wonderful rest and relaxation after a hard days worth of convention activities. I hope the new owners of this property continue to provide the excellent service and amenities which my group enjoyed in the past two years. It would certainly influence our decision to come back for our convention in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda Cool...”
Reviews.Author: mariadosTucson_Az
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location. The rooms are huge. It is a refurbished historic property. It is really well kept and kind of funky at the same time. It is quite charming. (Bring a 3 prong adaptor if you want to hook up your laptop. Plugs are few and there are not 3 prong plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: furb71
Reviews.Content: Well located by Balboa Park so easy to walk to the zoo. The staff were friendly and helpful and check in and check out were easy. The place has off street parking which was easy to find and get to. An older place but all the facilities were in good working order but an annoying lack of powerpoints in the kitchenette. Cheap laundry facilities if you wash your own clothes. The restaurant was a surprise with some nice food and great service. The piano player and singer were a good accompaniment while dining.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, traditional, convenient to Balboa Park”
Reviews.Author: eyemlucky
Reviews.Content: This old fashioned hotel has huge rooms and is located right by Balboa Park so I could walk to the museums, the zoo or just go for a nature walk. The restaurant on the roof is a big attraction during happy hour and a lot of people try to take the one elevator at that time. The free breakfast was good, fresh fruit, yogurt, bagels, really hot water for tea. It was expensive, but convenient because I did not have a car so I could walk.

Reviews.Title: “skip it!”
Reviews.Author: Brucheryl
Reviews.Content: Very old hotel with very old fixtures, appliances tub and toilet and musty smell throughout. Noisy room with street and guest noises. Great location for Balboa Park but not in the best area of interest for walking to other things. . No bellman or frills, but decent continental breakfast and friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Balboa Park”
Reviews.Author: josie018
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the Balboa Park, huge rooms (perfect for my 1 year old to move around). Simple decor, basic kitchen, but it had everything we needed. Very helpful staff. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: queeenofcakes59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were really impressed. As other reviewers have said, it's very easy to be here without a car - Balboa Park is just across the road and the airport is a short taxi ride away. And there are a lot of really nice local restaurants within walking distance. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - both gay friendly but also with everyone else. When we were there there was a wedding and all generations of a big family, who seemed to be having a great time and were made very welcome. It's not a modern branded chain hotel, so if you're looking for that you'd be disappointed, but if you want a clean, friendly, well located safe hotel, give it a try. We will definitely stay there again if we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “See it to experience it.”
Reviews.Author: macmacpherson
Reviews.Content: Very helpful guy at the front desk.. Roomy rooms. Great charm or "funk" if you prefer. Looking forward to breakfast on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Oversized Rooms, Excellent Location; Outstanding Value!”
Reviews.Author: WEFLYDELTA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Manor for a week while I was waiting for my lease to start on an apartment. The Park Manor has spacious accomodations. A studio was $109.00+tax;per night. It was larger than two standard hotel rooms, and had a kitchen and an eating area as well. Plenty of closet space a la american style; no tiny closets, or bathrooms. Old world charm exudes from this building that features a rooftop restaurant, as well as one on the lower floor too. The food is well prepared, good portions, and very reasonably priced. The staff are both pleasant and professional. Hotel is across from Balboa Park on Sixth Ave. This is the Park West area, and features a diverse array of restaurants all within a short walk from the Park Manor. Just a 10 minute ride to the airport, loads of transportation options are available. My wife and I have traveled extensively across the pond and this hotel comes highly recommended. Kudos to Trip Advisor for this service, I use it on a regular basis and use hotels based on the reviews submitted by others. Intrepid Florida US

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, heart of Hillcrest - lots to like”
Reviews.Author: PHXJeremy
Reviews.Content: Having lived previously in SD, I've known about Park Manor as a venue for weekly sunset happy hour - but hadn't really known it as a guest. Stayed there with friends this past weekend and had a great stay. The rooms are a bit dated, but so incredibly spacious that it's worth it. The location is simply perfect for hanging for the weekend in Hillcrest. Great shower water pressure, clean facilities. Yes, it's a 1920s building, so it's not going to be the W. The continental breakfast on the roof is a delightful start to the day. The hotel is quiet, and the beds are super comfortable. All in all - just a great place. Highly suggested.

Reviews.Title: “The Good The Bad & The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Tristan017
Reviews.Content: The Good The staff at this hotel are outstanding. Management is very responsive to your concerns. The 2nd room we were given #107 was like a small studio apartment with a full kitchen, breakfast nook and ample seating with a sofa and chairs. Very nice space. The view from the top of this hotel is beautiful and the full breakfast buffet they put out on new years day was great. The water pressure in the shower was really good and the bed was very comfortable.[not too soft and not too hard] Parking was free and even though the lot was full one night street parking was easy. The Bad The entire interior of the hotel from the rooms to the rooftop ballroom are very dated and need to be redone The radiator heating system is very noisy at times, as was street noise and noise from the cleaning staff in the hallway. My biggest complaint was our room had an adjoining door to another room and on the second night of our stay guests moved into this room. The lack of privacy between the rooms was very invasive as you could hear every word said by the people in the next room. It was as if they moved into your room. The Ugly The ugly was the first room we were given when we checked in Room 110. It had a strong odor in it that triggered my asthma. When I went to open the window the brass latch on top simply snapped off and almost cut me. The kitchen consisted of a fridge and a microwave in the closet dressing area. The room and decor were depressing and the room was not as large as advertised. If we had stayed in this room I would have given this hotel 1 star. Overall this place has the potential to be an amazing place if somebody would spend the money to update it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, superb views from atop but, alas, too old in its creaky bones.”
Reviews.Author: jdisvicomte
Reviews.Content: While the convenience of Park Manor Suites to the buzzing gay vibe of Hillcrest is desirable, its outdated heating and cooling systems, outdated furnishings, and woefully inadequate sound-proofing gave me more the sensation of staying in one of those wacky, personality-filled antique New York apartments. The staff are exuberant, competent and friendly -- a definite plus. If street noise, radiator clunking, neighbors' conversations and shouting in the hallways is not your ideal background sound for relaxation, then perhaps consider a more quiet stay in front of the 7-11 caddy corner to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A place that I would definitely stay at again”
Reviews.Author: lizpinky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Park Manor for only four nights in October. I wish it could have been longer. The staff were fantastic. Breakfast on the roof was a lovely way to start the day each day. One morning we watched an aircraft carrier come into the harbour which really made my husbands day. On our last night we went downstairs to the restaurant and had THE BEST food of our entire stay in America. Can 't recommend the place highly enough. Our accommodation was on the 6th floor and we had a very spacious room which was spotless. It was lovely to be able to have our windows open instead of having air con on. We had views of Balboa Park which was so pretty. If we go back to SanDiego in the future we would definitely love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Euro Style Hotel Brings Back Class and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: scottyhouston
Reviews.Content: WOW!! That's all I can say about our recent visit to San Diego and our stay at the Park Manor Suite Hotel. We booked the hotel months ago and sometimes trips you plan way in advance don't always workout. However, we absolutely LOVED our stay at the Park Manor. It's a very European style hotel, very classic look and layout. On first glance you MIGHT think it's very rundown and in need of a little updating. But it grows on you immediately. I will say that there are several areas that could be updated a little but quite frankly, I think if it changed too much it might alter the quaint, comfortable appeal the hotel has now. The service was great, everyone was extremely friendly. The free wireless internet worked really well and I never had any problems. One of the BEST part of our stay was the locale near The Hillcrest area and of course Balboa Park which is literally across the street. As for my one bedroom suite, I LOVED it and could have lived in that space indefinitely. The beds were amazingly comfortable and all the windows opened which was nice because the fresh air was great. My bathroom had been updated (the front desk told me they had remodeled many of the bathrooms and were working on all of them eventually). Housekeeping was great, they were in there immediately upon calling down for cleaning and one day I left for an hour and they had already come in on their own. There is a free continental breakfast on the top of the hotel (with breathtaking views). It's just your basic breakfast, nothing fancy, but certainly enough to hold you over for a better meal later on. I actually only went up there once as we were sleeping later than 10AM. In summary, I just want to say that I can't WAIT to head back to San Diego for another visit. The Park Manor is definitely my new home away from home when I travel there. I HIGHLY recommend you stay there if you plan on staying in that area of town.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NOVAGuy818
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a nice mix of old and new. The furniture and building are definitely on the older side. When I first walked into my room it gave me the feel of walking into my grandmother's house, which for me is not a bad thing. This is not to say the rooms have not been renovated in all the right ways. The bed was perfect and very comfortable, the bath was newly renovated, and having the kitchen was much nicer than eating out every night. The location was great - walking distance to the park and to Hillcrest. The hotel is gay owned and has a great happy hour on the roof deck on Fridays, but this is far from a "gay" hotel - it caters well to everyone. My only problem was the lack of air conditioning in the rooms. All of the windows opened wide and there was a ceiling fan, but the temperature as unusually hot during my stay which made it tough to sleep at night. I'm not certain that I would recommend staying here if the weather was expected to be hot, but I doubt if this is a problem most of the time since from what I'm told it is usually much cooler in San Diego than when I was there. The free parking and internet were a plus! The view from the room was amazing and a great place to eat breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic Hotel in a Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: KYTraveler17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Park Manor Suites during a recent week-long vacation. We were more than pleased with the hotel, the staff, and especially the location. A few specifics (and responses to some of the negative reviews I read): The Hotel Itself: A beautifully restored 1920s-era building. The suites are really apartments with lots of space. The building definitely has character--high ceilings, Murphy beds, built-in cabinetry. Our suite even had a grand piano! I felt like we'd walked into Bertie Wooster or Hercule Poirot's apartment. Everything was sparkling clean and well maintained. The only negative for us was noise from the street and the rooftop bar when we had the windows open (and the windows didn't completely block the noise). I'm not sure I would stay here in the summer when it's too warm to keep the windows shut. Food: The continental breakfast was good, although perhaps nothing to write home about. The menu included cereal, English muffins, pastries or banana bread, fruit, coffee, juice, milk, and yogurt. It's definitely fun eating on the rooftop patio overlooking downtown, the bay, and the park. We didn't eat in either of the restaurants, so I can't comment there. (However, one couple we ran into said they'd eaten at Inn at the Park several times during their stay.) Inn at the Park was running a $19.95 early-bird prix fixe menu when we were there. Location: Park Manor is literally across the street from Balboa Park. An easy (and safe) walk to the Zoo and other park attractions--1.5 miles tops. The hotel is also right on the edge of Hillcrest, so there's lots of dining within easy (and, again, safe) walking distance. (Among our favorites: Extraordinary Desserts, Chocolat, and Bread and Cie.) Several days we didn't even use our rental car. Other destinations are a bit farther away and would require a car or the bus, including downtown, the Embarcadero, the beaches, etc. The #120 bus stops a block from the hotel and provides easy access to the Fashion Valley Transit Center, where you can take the green line trolley. That bus or another one will get you downtown. Parking: The parking lot is small, but we never had a problem getting a space, even when we got back late in the evening. The hotel seems to work hard to keep people out who are just there for meals or special events. (Registered guests get a hang tag that forestalls towing.) Also, there is ample unmetered parking nearby. LGBT Issues: Park Manor Suites is proudly gay-friendly, as indicated by the rainbow flag above the entrance. Also, Hillcrest is the center of gay culture in San Diego. If you're easily offended, stay at a different hotel in a different part of town. Having said that, I think you would have to be very easily offended to encounter problems at the hotel and in the neighborhood. We found everyone, gay and straight alike, to be warm and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Old Charm by Balboa Park”
Reviews.Author: agumonster
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Park Manor and felt very much at home, because the hotel has an old apartment charm - large room with a full kitchen, dining table and amenities. There is a musty smell, especially in the hallways, as this is a historic old building with old carpet. Breakfast on the top floor was great. We towed our luggage upstairs ourselves with their cart, as a bell captain is not available, so if you plan to bring lots of suitcases, be forewarned. Nearby: San Diego Zoo and museums in Balboa Park Overall, we enjoyed staying here very much and the rates were also very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Building; Great Location; Great Room; Terrible En Suite”
Reviews.Author: CDinNI
Reviews.Content: Everything was good in the Suites except the en suite was rather dated and in need of some re-modeling. That may well just have been the suite we were in of course. Otherwise the Suites were excellent and reasonably priced for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel rooms need revamp”
Reviews.Author: leylandii
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel we fell in love with the original look of the hotel and lobby area and we were greeted warmly by the staff. The location of the hotel was great, right next to Balboa Park and the numerous museums and San Diego Zoo and about 2 miles from the Gaslamp area of SD. We went straight to our room to dump our bags and thats when some disappointment set in. It was a lovely large suite and relatively clean but the carpet looked like it had been there since the hotel was built (this is not a new hotel). Faded in numerous places and stained in others. The wallpaper and ceiling paper was peeling from the walls.The furniture seemed to have ben obtained from a second hand shop and therefore was all different. There was a complimentary breakfast available but on going up to the top floor for breakfast hardly any of the tables were laid out so you ended up going out on to the balcony area where none of the tables or chairs had been dried off from the overnight dew. the breakfast was normal american style continental breakfast with fruit, juices, bagels, bread, cereals and coffee. I had booked what I thought would be a romantic meal on the Sunday night at the Inn on the Park due to it being advertised as having a musical night with guest singers.Imagine my surprise when on entering the restaurant the place was 95% full of gay males all over the age of 40. There was no notification that this was a 'GAY' night and we had to watch males dancing, groping and kissing each other whilst eating which was not the type of entertainment that I expected to see. This is obviously a regular occurrence as a lot of the males were known by 1st name turns by the waiters and the singers. So if you book a meal at the Inn on the Park and you are not gay you might want to ask who the clientel are before booking. By the way the meal was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely big rooms, beautiful old building”
Reviews.Author: benmacd
Reviews.Content: Situated near Balboa park, this was a great hotel. We loved the large suites. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Also included was complimentary wifi access, free parking and a great breakfast on the rooftop, with a panoramic view of San Diego. The staff were friendly and helpful, and overall we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, antique ... ok, old.”
Reviews.Author: EricInSF
Reviews.Content: A historic building on the edge of Balboa Park and walking distance to Hillcrest. Beautiful architecture, exterior facade and charming, traditional public spaces. But my room was just plain old. The floors creaked, paper thin walls, the wall finishes were a bit worn, no forced air heat/AC, ceiling fans and radiators, doors that didn't fit quite well, and a bathroom in need of a renovation. A parking lot for 40 cars and 72 rooms, do the math. That aside, the staff at the hotel are great! The type of service you'd expect at a much more expensive hotel. They are attentive, friendly, and sincere. Would I stay here again? Probably not, since I much prefer a modern and contemporary space. But some would definitely appreciate the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in Sad Diego”
Reviews.Author: RonLittle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here at the end of a 3 week trip to California. This was the best of the 7 places we stayed during the trip. We selected this hotel because of the location and free parking and were not disappointed. The hotel is right across from Balboa Park with the zoo, Botanical Gardens, outdoor concerts, and many fine museums. The parking was free and despite concerns there was always a place when we needed it. It looked like the hotel used to be an apartment building. The room was huge. Besides the 2 queen beds there was a kitchen, dining area, dressing area, and bath. The wireless internet worked well as did the TV. There was a built in combination safe in the room and the staff was very friendly. One of the highlights was the dining area used for breakfast which was on the room level. Great selection of items with some hot dishes which were replenished frequently. Also a great view in all 4 directions including Balboa Park which is right across the street. The only thing missing was a pool. If this hotel had one it would rate 5 stars in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to sample San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sheedydavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the marathon because it was only a couple of blocks from the starting line. However, it is close to *everything*. Balboa Park, the Zoo, downtown, old town, the beach...all are easy to get to from the Hotel (we had a rental car). Staff were helpful and cheerful. Rooms are like old apartments - king size bed, big closet, small bathroom, full kitchen and dining room! The continental breakfast (free) is on the rooftop garden, with a view of the whole city. The restaurant downstairs is exquisite, old-time service, in a quaint setting. Food is fantastic (ahi shooters...sorbet between courses...). Yeah, the hallways smell a little like an old movie theater...so what? The rooms are big, roomy, airy, and clean. No A/C...but we are Canadians and were there in June...and the constant breeze through the open window kept us quite cool. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travellor10
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the Marriott Marina, But since my wife was joining me, I looked for a suites hotel. I couldn't have picked a better place... spacious rooms, free breakfast, Balboa Park and the great Hillcrest neighborhood. Could not recommend it more highly.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the Park Manor”
Reviews.Author: TechWolfie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Park Manor for our 11th anniversary. We have stayed here before and were pleased, except this time. Upon check-in, the person who helped us was rude and didn't pay attention to any details. He pulled up the wrong reservation and after I corrected he claimed that he got a name that was close to mine by accident. I have an unusal last name. Went to the room and found he gave us the wrong room, we booked a 1 bedroom and got a studio. Went back down to the desk where the same guy appeared to be "put out" that he had to fix his second mistake. NO HEAT. The building runs on a boiler and has the old steam type heaters. It was 58 degrees, and when I called about the heat I was told "not enough people complained yet to fire up the boiler", and sent up a space heater that barely kept the bedroom warm. The food in the restaurant was excellent and the service there was superb. Squeeky floors, but that's expected due to the hotels age. The rooms SERIOUSLY need updating. It's close to the gay nightlife which makes it a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Great location, Fabulous customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Georsell
Reviews.Content: Summary: I originally booked a room at the Hilton Gaslamp, but rolled the dice on Park Manor after reading review on Trip Advisor. I had never stayed at the Park Manor before. But guess what? I will from now on. Front Desk Staff: My partner and I walked into the historic and artful lobby, and at the front desk stated "Reservation for Mr. X". Without consulting a roster or computer screen, Sue smiled at us, replying "Hello Russ! How are you today?" I did not know Sue, and what an amazing first impression! The staff cares. Room / Housekeeping: Fabulous views from the balcony, and all the comforts of home. Yes, the rooms are old, oversized and classic, but that's the charm...or go ahead and stay in a "bland box" somewhere else. Nice fresh linens and our housekeeper always kept the rooms spotless and somehow managed to pop in and out when we were gone, even if for a short while. Restaurant / Bar: The bartender "Jersey" is a hoot, welcoming or just quietly efficient, depending on your mood. A true professional, or as I say, a "bartender's bartender". The Chef –who practically trips over himself to make you anything he can– wowed us with fantastic meals and one of the best cheese plates, including placing a slice of honeycomb next to the (St. Agur?) Bleu. Salty and Sweet. Perfection. I usually skip hotel restaurants. Don't make that mistake at the Park Manor. Location: Fabulous! Why stay in the tourist district when you can stay in a neighborhood directly adjacent to Balboa Park? It's a 5 min. drive to the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, good amenities, like a stay at Grandma's”
Reviews.Author: tlackey
Reviews.Content: Ok, starting in the lobby and with the staff. The lobby is opulent and there is an elevator. Yea! Staff is very nice and accommodating. Couldn't ask for sweeter, more helpful people. Location: Nice location across from Balboa Park, near museums and zoo. You can take No. 3 bus to Gaslamp district. Or if you're healthy, you can walk. PARKING IS FREE! A big plus in San Diego. Room: So so. Clean, but could use some updating. Maybe a good coat of paint on the walls. Bathrooms are fine, updated, but medicine cabinet, etc., are old, and some furniture is beat up. Big! And I got the small room. It has a kitchen, which is a big plus if you're staying a while. Bed is nice, but if you can't use a cotton bowling ball for a pillow, bring your own. I got a great rate, so I can't complain. Kind of noisy at about 5 a.m. in my room and NO AIR CONDITIONER. So you might now want to stay in the summer. If you're staying for awhile in San Diego, and you just need a place to crash where you could cook if you wanted, this is a great place. I felt like I went back in time, visiting my grandma, who hadn't done a lot of updating but had plenty of room for a week.

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly,clean,conveniently located,affordable stay in the city!!”
Reviews.Author: ms-cunningham
Reviews.Content: From the very first time I placed a cross-country call to the hotel to ask some questions about its location and accessibility to places by foot and by bicycle, I was greeted by the most cheerful, helping guys. Joe was able to answer all of my many questions. While staying for the week the guys at the front desk were most helpful in getting us tkts to the zoo as well as a play in town and always had great suggestions for restaurants in the city. The happy hr on Wed along with the piano bar and singers was super. The breakfast on the 7th FL with the panoramic views were great also. While staying in the "smallest suite" we had plenty of room and the housekeeping was fabulous. Sue, activities coordinator and Ed, mgr were soooooooo personable and fun to socialize with and would be fun to see again on our next visit. From South Carolina with gratitude, Rita

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Ted Fry
Reviews.Content: The Park Manor in San Diego is an excellent choice for travelers who appreciate the charm of an older, non-chain hotel. Over the weekend of my stay (New Year's 2010), I noticed an abundance of international and gay travelers. Its in-house restaurant, Inn At The Park, came highly recommended, but I didn't have a chance to visit. Its location couldn't be better for those of us who prefer to walk: on a quiet street right next to Balboa Park, an easy stroll to the Zoo, the restaurants and nightlife of Hilllcrest (and the Gaslamp Quarter in the other direction). Travelers will appreciate the enormous rooms (much larger than anything else in the same price range), walk-in closets, full kitchens and free parking; even a 24-hour 7-11 across the street. I found the staff to be gracious and accommodating. Travelers should note that its rooftop is often used for weddings, parties, and other events -- but who travels without earplugs nowadays? Be aware, too, this is an older property, with the kind of dim lighting, slow elevator and antique furniture/fixtures that you won't find downtown at the W. OTOH, if you can skip all that in lieu of old-world charm and palm trees outside your window, then the Park Manor is for you. There's no other hotel in San Diego for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: jtimms
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is that this is the largest and nicest room I've stayed in at this price range, excellent location to Hillcrest and the park, and phenomenal service! The large room (a single King suite) was unexpected, as well as the walk-in closet and huge windows. I chose to stay an extra night and extend my trip. I will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “We'll Keep Coming Back!”
Reviews.Author: drluccia
Reviews.Content: I first encountered the Park Manor in the late 80s-early 90s when it was mostly a residential hotel. Management decided to switch to a regular hotel many years ago. This gem of an old-world lodging is not for those requiring cookie-cutter, hermetically-sealed, corporate tiny boxes. It is for anyone who seeks excellent service, quirky charm, fabulous location, wonderful food, and a place to stay that can be a destination in itself. Yes, there is no air conditioning. This is San Diego; open the windows, turn on the silent and efficient ceiling fans, if you need to, and enjoy the fresh air. The steam heat is more than sufficient to warm the rooms if you need heat in the cooler months. My first stay in late Spring '06 revealed a warm room that cooled down in minutes once the windows were opened. I've not been in the same room twice in three more visits over the past three years and my experience was the same each time. My spouse and I were married here in '08 and the other five members of our wedding party all stayed here. Each room is a unique decorating experience with an eclectic blend of vintage or antique furniture including pieces the former owner collected throughout his lifetime and spread throughout the hotel. Our small, intimate wedding dinner was given the same high level of care and attention to detail as the large weddings held in the penthouse the same weekend. The food was exquisite, the service extremely professional, and everything from the flowers to the cake to the complimentary bottle of sparkling cider in our room after the wedding dinner was perfect. (We are non-drinkers, so our preference was honored. Sparkling wine or champagne would be the standard fare, we were told.) My spouse and I returned last spring for a getaway weekend and were pleasantly surprised that the staff remembered our names and greeted us like old friends. I've noticed this do this with all their guests and thus is revealed a high level of training, competence, and professionalism; not always present in either less-pricey or more-pricey corporate travel boxes. Our getaway was spent enjoying some of the wonderful Balboa Park museums and the Hillcrest neighborhood. Hillcrest is also eclectic, welcoming, and full of great restaurants and shops for every taste. Oh, yeah, it's the "gay" neighborhood, whatever that means anymore. Walk around, enjoy the park, take in the local color, find cuisine from Afgani to traditional delicatessen, from sushi to down home comfort food, and coffeehouses that aren't cut from the Seattle cloth (although there is indeed a Starbucks if you require homogeneity in your caffeine delivery system). The complimentary breakfast on the rooftop is more than enough to get you started and includes views of the city down to the harbor and over Balboa Park and Hillcrest. Bagels, fresh fruit, cereal, juices, and coffee are among your choices to accompany the bracing dose of fresh air in the morning. The wifi worked perfectly; no drops, delays, or glitches. I teach online courses and was able to accomplish my daily postings, grades, comments, and email without a hitch; access to one school's VPN was flawless, as well. We returned for an anniversary weekend with my maid of honor and her husband this fall. We shared a two bedroom suite. One room had a balcony, one did not, but each room was spacious with a king bed that was very comfortable. The only real challenge came in sharing one bathroom, but reasonable people can always work this out. The bathrooms are small in this hotel, but how much room does one really need? I prefer the spacious living room, bedrooms, and kitchen to a cavernous bathroom, anyway. We have already reserved our suite for next year. At the time of our wedding, I required a cane to walk (post-cycle crash). I had no difficulty getting around and would recommend this hotel to both seniors and people with disabilities. Yes, the building is old. Whatever. But, it is in good repair and is truly unique. It has a history and sense of place that the chain travel boxes will never possess. If you prefer the aromas of outgassing plastics, glues, and other synthetics to fresh air, then stay in a corporate chain hotel and breathe deeply. We prefer the fresh air this old building lets us let in or not, out choice, not some accountant's. The old-school piano bar is a treat. It is not unusual for patrons to join in whether they can sing or not. If you want high polish and glitz, go to Vegas. This is one of many neighborhood bars with all that means. When we were here for our wedding dinner, the pianist/singer stopped by our party to solicit requests which started off her next set. Our response to the pianist's inquiry about special occasions this year was greeted with applause and offers for drinks from the regulars. It was just one more feather in the cap of this very unique, hidden secret of a hotel as hotel lounges or bars are far too often joyless, dreary places. To sum up, the Park Manor retains the ambience and charm that hotels provided in gentler times past; when travel was more arduous than it usually is today and when people routinely lived in hotels. It is a reminder that San Diego's year-round climate has always been an enormous part of its appeal and that we can live quite well without stomping about with enormous carbon footprints. As a place to jump off to the rest of your San Diego adventure, it is unique, welcoming, professional, and very calming. We will keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Funky old hotel with huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: rwbinnyc
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here in October 2009. The hotel has a parking lot that you can use for free which was nice except that it fills up quickly. The room was really large with high ceilings and big windows that open. no AC but the fan did the trick in October weather. The bed is really nice but the rest of the furniture is tired looking. The tub looked a little scary but Im still happy to have stayed there, the staff was very friendly and the location cant be beat. walking distance to Hillcrest and the gaslamp district is not too far but a little too much to hike. Balboa Park is right across the street. Free continental breakfast which wasnt too bad. Nice view from the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Park manor Suites San Diego”
Reviews.Author: springbok
Reviews.Content: Location- beautiful. Overlooks Balboa park Service by hotel staff- efficient, accommodating and friendly Rooms-just gorgeous. Filled with interesting period furniture. Spacious. Everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dated, but great charm and glad we stayed.”
Reviews.Author: Scottinaboat
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews not sure what we were to expect. The hotel is an old 1920 apartment building and still looks that way. The rooms are very spacious with full kitchen, living room, balcony and bedroom. If your looking for modern luxury hotel, then find another spot. But if you like quirky places, and a sense of European flair, this is the place. The hotel has a strong gay clientele, but still many tourists, baby strollers and the like stay there as well. If your looking for a great gay happy hour, check out the roof top on Friday night for a great cocktail party. I would recommend this to most anybody gay or straight, the location is great overlooking Balboa park, walking distance to to the San Diego Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GoFoot
Reviews.Content: The exterior of this hotel is inviting. It's just disappointing to get to your room. It's an old, tired place in need of updates, a cleaning, and repair. WiFi ? FORGET IT. They say they have it. Dial up is a better option. Do not stay there and expect to have workable internet access that allows actual work to be done. Paper thin walls. NO air conditining. Lots of traffic/road noise. Paint peeling off bathroom wall. Very old television. Park Manor Suites has lots of potential but it's woefully lacking at this stage. San Diego has numerous top notch hotels. This is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Best restaurant food!”
Reviews.Author: woodyjen99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here overnight for a quick San Diego trip. We had a large room, that was a combination of old charm and newer linens and amenities. The bed was huge and very modern but the extras in the room were very delicate, sophisticated and charming. The bathroom was quite tiny but it went with the decor and times. The location of the hotel is great, right on Balboa Park and in a nice area, quiet. All of the staff to the front desk clerk to the waiter to the host to the other employees we ran in to were so very gracious and nice. But the best part was the restaurant food! By far the best dinner my husband and I have had in a while. Restaurant is very dark and romantic, but active and it was packed when we were there. There is a bar off to the side that was also packed. Seating was private and with the dim lighting and ornate decorations, it was very romantic. I had the best fruit crisp I've ever had and the duck appetizer to the entrees and bread, were all amazing! I've eaten at a lot of nice places but this one was the best and service was great. The hotel has old world charm and is a quiet and pleasing change.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift & an exterminator”
Reviews.Author: goddessblew
Reviews.Content: My first room here smelled musty, had outdated furniture and needed serious bathroom and kitchen reno. I could've tolerated everything but the smell. Although I was moved to a more updated room, (the staff was very accommodating and helpful), I realized the smell couldn't be avoided. It is an old hotel. The furniture and carpet weren't as old as my previous room so the smell wasn't as bad. But this evening I came back to the room and an uninvited guest went scurrying across the floor as the lights went on. I grew up in NY so I've had my fill of roaches. I sit here writing this review trying to avoid the unavoidable; going to sleep knowing that a roach has full run of the room while I slumber. I think that sums up the Park Manor experience. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Better... impossible!”
Reviews.Author: allertstar
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit to San Diego and I decided to stay at the Park Manor Suites hotel since it seemed to be close to San Diego Zoo. The hotel is conveniently located in front of Balboa Park, walking distance to San Diego Zoo, The Old Globe, The San Diego Art Museum and more. I arrived very early with my boyfriend and even though we were early to check in the Front Desk manager offered to hold our luggage for us. She also gave us some suggestions for breakfast and tickets for the zoo which saved us time when we got there. When we came back from the zoo the room was ready. We walked into a nice suite with a balcony facing the beautiful city of San Diego. The hotel has two restaurants, one of them is on top of the building which has a breathtaking view of the city. The other one is downstairs, it reminded me to the Speakeasy restaurants back in the 30's with live music after 7 pm. Although this was an absolutely amazing experience in our short stay I had to say that there was only one incident that overshadowed our stay. We wanted to rent a car since we arrived to the hotel and even though we were given the phone number for Enterprise and we called them directly, there was never an offer from the FD to get it for us so we ended up taking taxis on our first day since the car rental company never called us back. The Park Manor hotel is a truly jewel in San Diego, we'll recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, it's old, but that's ok.”
Reviews.Author: SailinBud
Reviews.Content: From previous reviews, we had a pretty good idea of what we were getting into. It's an old hotel, the fixtures are dated, and our room did have a vaguely mildewy smell. There's no A/C. All of that was more than made up for by the feel of the place. We had a suite with a balcony (highly recommended), and we kept the french doors open all the time. So much nicer than a hermetically sealed Hilton. The staff was friendly and responsive. Great meal in the restaurant downstairs. We were initially taken aback by the group of gay men singing show tunes at the piano bar, but it was really a hoot. Very convenient location, right across the street from Balboa Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: PaulxLondon
Reviews.Content: Second stay in the Park Manor Suites just as enjoyable as the first. Although not as modern and trendy as some hotels, the staff are great and the bar is fun too. Very gay friendly with largish rooms and in a very nice location near the park. If it had a pool and a garden it would be just perfect but then I guess it would cost more. Good value as it is now.

Reviews.Title: “A European Style Hotel with a sense of community”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler33
Reviews.Content: In contradiction to the prior review, there was no smell of gas in the hotel (I have a keen sense). The hotel is very much in the European style; yes, the bathroom is small, but there is a lovely courtyard, a nice foyer, and the room was very comfortable and large. The wireless is free. The service excellent. There is a wonderful tea/coffee lounge a mere 1/2 block away. The restaurant, Inn at the Park, had great food, enjoyable live entertainment, and more importantly, professionalism with the right touch of friendliness to make a solo business traveler very comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance of the business district, a Starbucks, Rite Aid, Whole Foods and Buffalo Exchange all convenient. This will be my hotel of choice for all future business trips. While there is no fitness center on site, the park across the street provides for a lovely jog; and an inexpensive day pass ($6.50) can be purchased to a local gym.

Reviews.Title: “Too much Gas”
Reviews.Author: fun2travelCanberra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and dated. The furnishings are very old andthe whole hotel needs refurbishing. There are gas stoves in the rooms and the first room we went into smelt strongly of gas. They moved us to another room and that wasn't so bad. The hotel did admit they have an ongoing problem with the smell of gas throughout the building. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I chose this hotel for its proximity to the zoo but it is still too far to walk there. If I stayed in San Diego again I would choose a downtown hotel where it is close to shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Emphasis on "old" world charm”
Reviews.Author: Manmtn
Reviews.Content: Overall a basic place to stay, a renovated hotel from back in the day. Limited parking spaces and SMALL bath. Best for those making an extended stay where a 3/4 kitchen is needed. For those on a weekend trip or only in town for a few days, look elsewhere. Location is close Balboa Park but not where shuttle bus runs. And its a couple block walk to get to main area of Balboa. If driving in town the hotel is centrally located, minutes to downtown, old town, balboa, and marina. But everything in the San Diego area is really close to one another.

Reviews.Title: “a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: ejminme
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent visit at Park Manor Suites and can echo many of the positive comments made earlier. The location was perfect for us, easy for our friends to find us and a short walk to the busy area of Hillcrest along University Avenue where there are plenty of restaurants to choose from.
