The park across the street from the hotel is wonderful for walking or relaxing; our trip was short and busy so we didn't make it to the zoo or museums. Our room on the fourth floor was spacious, with a well-maintained old world style that is hard to find these days. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom facilities were just fine. The gold star goes to the hotel's staff who were friendly, courteous and helpful at all the right times. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: lsmlady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Manor Suites for nine nights in late December and early January. I booked a 2 Queen suite for two adults and two teens. My parents, brother, sister and her family also stayed there in separate rooms. I picked this place because of location, large room size, and the full kitchen. These were all big pluses. LOCATION: The manor is located directly across from the balboa park. We walked to the museums and the zoo. It took about ten to 15 minutes to get to the museums , and another 5 minutes to get to the zoo. The walk was too long for my parents, and they drove. Park Manor Suites is close to great restaurants in the Hillcrest area and also close to downtown--without the downtown prices. ROOM SIZE, FURNISHINGS etc: The suites are over 500 sq feet with lots of drawers and closet space. We really liked the extra space. The one bedrooms are around 750 sq ft. The beds were comfortable, no one in my family had any complaints. There was peeling paint in a couple places in our room. KITCHEN: We had a full kitchen-- gas stove w/ four burners, full size refrigerator freezer, microwave and table w/ three chairs. Everything worked. We also had lot of cupboard space, which was nice. The kitchen is furnished with pots, pans, flatwear and a few utensils. It is fine for preparing simple meals. The manor was built in the 20s, and this shows most in the kitchen. The manor is located about a mile from a big supermarket and a trader joes. BREAKFAST: The breakfast was a typical expanded continental breakfast: 4 types of cold cereal, fruit juices, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels and cream cheese, instant oatmeal packets, hot chocolate, tea, and coffee,--no eggs or waffle maker. The breakfast room has a great view of the City. PARKING: Parking was included and we were always able to find a spot except for one night when my sister had to park on the street half a block away. We did not stay out late, and were back by 9:00 about everynight. Parking may be more of a problem for late arriving guests. GENERAL COMMENTS: Everyone in our group seemed fairly happy with the rooms. There were a couple complaints: 1) no way to adjust the temperature for personal comfort level because of central heating. 2) You can hear sirens from time to time, but not while we slept. There is a computer room for guests, which my teen liked. I used it to print off boarding passes. The staff was wonderful. Originally, I was not going to stay at the manor because their website shows prices jump up for the week end. Because my sister and I each stayed a week, they charged us the regular nightly rate on the weekend but we needed to book my phone. I thought we received an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “christmas at the "park"”
Reviews.Author: mugos
Reviews.Content: i disagree with the reviews and online info that this a great place for seniors to stay. Balboa park is across the street from the hotel but not where the zoo or museums are at. a tour guide said this is a place for locals to picnic or walk their dogs. the trolley(a free trolley around balboa park) is not "across the street" but 2 blocks away(not even to far for seniors to walk) but not across the street. dinners at the hotel are $25 and up(once again not a price most seniors would pay) there is a soso mexican restaurant across the street or a 5 to 6 block walk to another rrestaurant. transportation is a taxi or city bus close by, still to far to walk at night even from a bus stop. we found very few attractions within walking distance! the staff were very friendly and helpful. the view from the 7th floor is fantastic. only breakfast and lunch are served here. the continental breakfast is good but hard to fi nd a clean table to sit at. upon leaving i requested a taxi to take us to amtrak(2 miles away) we were told the gentleman sitting the lobby was our ride. he did not work for the hotel but told us he charged the same as the taxis even tho he drove a towne car. upon entering the car he said the charge would be $15/we only paid a cab $8 to take us to the hotel. why would the hotel allow this???? the rooms were nice but not exceptional/the shower was horrible. i would class it as a one step up from a regular motel room

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JamezWDC
Reviews.Content: With a short ride from the airport, a central location that's close to several great areas of the city and a spectacular staff - this was the perfect place for me to spend my birthday weekend. The front desk staff were full of good recommendations for events, how to get around and where to eat. I even got a great recommendation for a facial. My room was a "studio" but huge, it had its own kitchen, a walk in closet, and a very comfortable bed. I had more room than I probably needed. I walked to Balboa Park and the Zoo from the hotel, a long but beautiful walk and in a nice neighborhood. My next visit to San Diego will likely be booked at this same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chayadina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a colleague. As I had never previously visited San Diego I felt that such a recommended would be helpful. This is both a hotel and a residential building. The rooms are really apartment size accommodations. The 1920s feeling was evident in all the rooms. Beds were fluffy and comfortable. The towels were very high quality. As a Midwesterner I was a little nervous due to the unseasonable temperatures (80s/90s) and no air conditioners but there were both ceiling fans in each room and the stand up fans in the bedrooms that did indeed help cool the space at night. Being close to Balboa Park and the airport were very convenient. Loved the breakfast on the rooftop!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Oklahomawind
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Park Manor Suites. The location was great and the staff was very friendly and provided great service. Our room was bigger than we expected and tidy though outdated. It was comfortable even without air conditioning but the room had a ceiling fan and a box fan. There is only one elevator but stairs gave us needed exercise. We were on the 6th of 7 floors. The morning breakfast wasn't much to brag about but the view from the rooftop on the 7th floor where it was served was fantastic. They offer a nice happy hour on Friday evening which brings men from across the city. It does have a mix of gay and straight patrons but everyone seemed okay with it. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cja0412
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Park Manor Suites for 5 nights in mid-October of this year and we had a fantastic experience. Walking into our room was like taking a trip back to my grandma's house with all the antiques, 70's style art on the walls, and an old-fashioned bathroom. We immediately opened all the windows and enjoyed the fantastic San Diego weather. The room is definitely old as others have commented previously, but the subtle nuances of a historic place such as Park Manor Suites draw your eye more than the somewhat shabby carpets! I do enjoy vintage items and perhaps that's what allowed me to cast a not-so-critical view on the entire place. The continental breakfast every morning at the top of the hotel provided ample sustenance and beautiful scenery. I was wowed every time we stepped out to enjoy our bagel, fruit, and coffee! The hotel sits on the edge of Balboa Park and though you can hop on a trolley to take you into the main area of the park, my boyfriend and I prefered to explore by foot and found the walk to be more than doable and the views stunning. Hillcrest, the small neighborhood where the Park Manor is located, is truly a gem of a place. Nice people, great boutique shops, and a seemingly unlimited number of coffee shops (yay!). We felt very much at home. All in all, we very much enjoyed our stay at the Park Manor where the staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms quaint and unique, and the location absolutely unbeatable. P.S.: Make sure you take a trip down to the basement to view some interesting pictures of the Park Manor, San Diego, and other parts of California dating back to the mid-1800's!!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with great service and a superb location”
Reviews.Author: HopSkipJump
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place with a more personal feel (rather than those big corporate hotel chains) so we asked a local for a recommendation and she suggested the Park Manor Suites. The hotel is a mix of good, and not so good so I'll try to give both sides. First, we stayed during a period of warmer than usual October temperature (80 F / 26 C) so the most apparent downside to staying at the hotel was the lack of air conditioning. We were on vacation with friends so we occupied a 2-bedroom suite (which had 2 king beds, a balcony overlooking the park, a queen-sized sofa bed in the living room, a dining room and a kitchen. There were 3 TVs but we never turned them on (too busy). Our friends stayed in a 1-bedroom suite which had similar features but in place of the sofa bed was a standard sofa plus there was a "murphy' bed (fold out bed, that was stored in a compartment in the wall in the living room. Both our rooms had whisper-quiet ceiling fans that did an excellent job of keeping the rooms at a comfortable temperature during the day. When I went to sleep, however, I turned my ceiling fan off (since the breeze from it was disturbing me in bed). There was a different fan (mounted on a pedestal) that was in the closet that i could have used but I didn't bother. As it turned out, on all three nights, I awakened in the morning with a "soggy pillow" (so to speak) as the temperature had risen a little during the night (probably from the heat rising from the lower floors of the building -- we were near the top). I could have plugged in the pedestal fan on subsequent nights but I didn't bother -- so, it's up to you. All in all, it wasn't a huge problem. The only other negatives would be that the baths and kitchens are showing some wear. The room was immaculate but the kitchen cabinet doors were a little warped in places, the grout/caulk in the tub had small areas with a little bit of black on them (as someone involved in property management, I can tell you that it's difficult to remove these types of black marks once they "set in"). In addition, there was an occasional rusty spot on some of the old hardware. To me, I didn't consider the room "dirty" because of these small stains but i know there are some that would feel differently. The decor was pleasant, if not a little quirky in places. We noticed a couple of prints in one corner of the living room depicting a woman and a goose in a rather unconventional pose. (Don't get me wrong. It wasn't licentious -- just a little strange! I think they called it "art" in the 1920s/1930s. Our 2-bedroom suite had large rooms: both bedrooms had king beds. There was a sofa and a couple of wing chairs in the living room and the dining room had a table and 4 chairs. The balcony overlooking the park was small (you could stand maybe 2 people) but it was a lovely view. The kitchen had a stove, microwave and refrigerator. I can''t say enough about how great the service was. We were three friends coming from 3 different cities, arriving at three different times and the hotel was great at recommending appropriate room sizes, getting us oriented, suggesting restaurants, etc. Especially outstanding was Joe at the front desk/reception. There was a business center with a PC that you could use at no charge. The rooftop (7th floor) was a restaurant / meeting room / dual balcony areas where complimentary breakfast was served (great views) as well as lunch (extra charge). There is a Friday night party between 5 pm and 10 pm that is open to the guests as well as the public. The hotel does not advertise the party but it is well-known and has been going on for years. It is mostly attended by gay people in the city but my friends and I (as well as other guests we spoke to) felt perfectly comfortable at the party. It takes place on the northeast patio of the roof as well as in the inside penthouse meeting room so there are spectacular views. My "alcohol heavy" mixed drink cost $6 -- a buy. (I'm told that the bartender at the outdoor patio bar pours the stiffer drinks; I guess I got lucky). My friends and I both had rental cars and we had no problem parking in the parking lot (included) even on Friday evening during the party. The parking area is NOT open to the public (in spite of a prior reviewer's allusion to the contrary) but the hotel did explain to us when we checked in that there are not quite enough spaces for all of the rooms but since some people don't have cars it is unlikely that there would not be parking. In any event, except for Friday night, there appeared to be ample parking adjacent to the hotel. The location of the hotel cannot be beat. Literally steps to Balboa Park. There is a free tram that picks up every 15 minutes adjacent to the hotel that stops throughout the massive park. The Hillcrest neighborhood is within walking distance and has plenty of eating and drinking places. Getting to the airport is a snap (I did it a bunch of times, picking up and dropping off my friends). You just drive south on Park to Laurel, turn right and take it to the end. (About 10 minutes) We got to the Wild Animal Park, Pacific Beach and Coronado Island with no difficulty. There is a piano bar and restaurant on the lower level (below the lobby, a tiny bit below street level). We didn't eat there but we heard good things from other guests. All in all, a most pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - but be informed”
Reviews.Author: rosspk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Park Manor Suites, booked thorugh Expedia. I contacted the Hotel via email to ask a couple of questions prior to arriving, and was answered really promptly by the general manager, along with some helpful info. Great service. Check in day we arrived about an hour before regular check in time, no problem. Staff were great & put us straight into a room. Top notch bed and linen, big room with a decent kitchen. The furniture was old style, but actually appeared fairly new. Housekeeping were terrific and we had no concerns whatsoever about cleanliness, although housekeeping will be looking for a tip via a supplied envelope. Complimentary bottled water in the room on arrival. The front desk staff were always friendly and helpful, looked up some phone numbers for me etc. We didn't have a car whilst in San Diego, but there is a town car that services the Hotel each morning. Martin, the owner/driver said he was charging the same rates as taxis, but after spending time in taxis later in our US trip, I reckon he was a fair bit cheaper. Top guy and very informative. Room rates were great & the complimentary breakfast was decent, although you did have to pounce on certain items that were not refreshed as often as others. Great place, great service, great stay - but do take into account the negative comments that have also been posted to avoid disappointment. The place is old, the floor was creaky, the bathroom is small and old (but clean). There is no air conditioning. The place did generally have a bit of a bad smell, don't know what it was or where it was coming from. Leaving the room fan switched on seemed to be enough to clear the smell though. On the weeked we were there they were hosting a gay wedding reception, so you will be close to the gay community whilst here. If these things bother you, you wil need to stay elsewhere. Otherwise, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Park Manor is Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix_Maven
Reviews.Content: Great place! They even squeezed my reservation in -- and gave me a room with a terrific view -- without my asking! Rooms are extraordinarily clean with tasteful, modern bed linens. Remember, it's a vintage-era hotel, but bathrooms are updated, and there are definitely modern hotel conveniences -- like room card locks. The staff couldn't be nicer! I felt like they were genuinely glad that I was there! The location can't be beat. You're right by Balboa Park and within walking distance to Hillcrest neighborhood and a variety of restaurants, bars and nightclubs. Downtown is just minutes away. I would definitely recommend the Park Manor!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: PeruchoGuatemala
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to California with my family, I booked this hotel directly. Their website does not resemble the photos shown of their facilities. Here are some examples: -The hotel is very old, and the furniture as well. -Two of us slept on a "pull out chester" in the livingroom, and could not sleep as the springs were felt on ones back because the thin and old mattress. -The kitchen and bathrooms are very old, not maintained well , and the metal parts are rusted. -It had no air conditioned, only old and very noisy ceiling fans. - Early morning the garbage truck picked up the trash and made a horrible noise - A neighbor dog barked from 6AM on. - They offer a parking place, but on weekends they have a show and bar for everybody , including non residents, so when we came back from an in town dinner before midnight, all the parking was taken and had to leave our car parked on the street. -One feels unsafe by watching some of the persons walking around. -The whole Hotel smells bad. -I have nothing against Gays, but the photo in their website on the front of the Hotel does not show the rainbow flag, that is hanging next to the US, and California flags. I would say that about 75% of custumers are gay, and when I asked the person who made our room , she confirmed. It just made me feel unconfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: Our wonderful experience of this hotel started at check in. We stayed here 2 nights in August as part of a 3week tour of California from the UK. As we checked in we were informed that they were upgrading us to the Presidential Suite. The suite was amazing with 2 large double bedrooms, lounge, kitchen and hallway with en-suite bathrooms. The suite is decorated to a very high standard with antiques etc. We arrived on the friday evening and was pleased to discover a party on the roof top for the gay community and travellers alike. The happy hour lasted from 5 - 10pm, we had a great evening and met some great people. The hotel is located right on the edge of the beautiful Balboa Park and within walking distance to the zoo. The city Centre is a short taxi ride away. All the hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Surprises”
Reviews.Author: trvlgirl88
Reviews.Content: Our comments about Park Manor Suites are below based on our July, 2008, stay. Pros: The bed was very comfortable. Cons: Listed below 1) There was a chair in the room with a cracked leg that might very well have collapsed if too much weight had been placed on it. 2) There were numerous electrical code violations - three prong plugs had been plugged into two prong adapters without any ground wire attachment, especially in the kitchen area where water is used. 3) When we attempted to use one of the front burners on the stove, the burner did not light. After we smelled the gas, we decided to keep the windows open. We are glad that the windows were open when we entered the room. 4) We feel fortunate that we were not traveling with children because the window screens had visable gaps, which was a safety concern for us. 5) The very heavy picture, which hung above the bed, was not securely attached. Fortunately, we had already checked out by the time the moderate earthquake shook the area the next day. 6)We also noticed that the elevator permit had been expired for about one year. In this case, pictures really are worth a thousand words, so we have attached photos to document what we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: foobah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older as some others have commented, but everything about my stay was excellent. Let me just turn to some other's comments that stick in my mind. The location is fine if one has a car. Naturally it can be reached by taxi. Once there it was possible to walk to a busy area around Sixth and University. From there one could take buses that connect with the city's good transportation system. I must admit I drove to Old Town where I could park free all day, and from there I could take trolleys even to the Mexican border, to Petco ballpark or other areas around the city. If you are unfamiliar with San Diego and driving I would recommend a GPS system will be very helpful in getting around. The complimentary breakfast is very good. I actually went away feeling I had overeaten. There was cereal, juices, fruit, yogurt, cottage cheese, sweet rolls, bagels, English muffins, coffee, milk and other things I have forgotten. The view from the top of the hotel where breakfast is served was very pleasant. If the hotel is rather full then parking at night in the hotel lot can be problematic, but there are many available spots on the streets right around the hotel. The presentation of the food in the restaurant is first rate, and my dinner of prime rib was good, but I somehow felt I was in the hands of a young chef who was trying very hard... The room was spotless, including the kitchen. The bed was perfect. The couch was a tad thread-worn on one pillow (I must find something negative, right?). The Wifi in the room was a bit weak at times, yet I could always get on-line. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just as promised”
Reviews.Author: BeachedCanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (and 14 month old) stayed at the Park Manor Suites for one week in late June and it lived up to its billing - both good and the "not as good". We found the reviews herein to be quite accurate and very informative. Essentially, the hotel is older and is a "character" or heritage-style property. If you are seeking modern, sleek accommodations - this is not it. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, however they are a bit dated or "tired" and rather old. Think of it as staying at Grandma's for a few days - out of date but comfy and functional! The service is quite reasonable - we never lacked for anything we requested and found the staff all to be pleasant and welcoming. Parking is limited and could be a real challenge in late evening. However, we always found a spot (squeezing in some tight spots the couple times we were back late). They are open about this and the reviews all mention it so take this into account if it's an issue for you. The property is conveniently located, close to downtown, Balboa Park (we walked to the Zoo w/ stroller). Breakfast was fine for us - bagels, pastries, fruit, cereal, juices, coffee/tea, etc. If you were there for weeks it might get boring but we liked it. I've read reviews where people complain (no omlettes etc.) and I simply say - if you want that you end up paying for it so go to the $200 a night places to get your darn omlette station! American travellers tend to be a bit food obsessed anyway, so take those reviews with a grain of salt! It's a functional breakfast and if you need more - you probably ought to think about dieting! This is not meant to insult, rather a commentary on the obscene portion sizes in the States. It's no wonder there is an obesity epedemic!! There is no a/c (we knew that in advance) but it was not an issue at all. The ceiling fan works well enough and it was never an issue the whole week we were there (and I'm a Canadian who struggles iniitally in humid heat!). If you are a conservative American, typical Republican, or "redneck" - consider staying elsewhere! This is a gay-friendly property and you will encounter homosexual guests and/or staff. It was totally fine with us (it's not contagious people:), but again, if you have an issue with this don't [--] that nobody warned you! We weren't the only family there either - this hotel is great for budget conscious families who need space and would rather spend $$ on fun than on a fancy hotel. All in all, you get what you pay for - and considering the excessive hotel prices in San Diego , the Park Manor is a great value for the dollar. If you are open-minded, non-homophobic, and ok with heritage (read "a bit old"), you can really can't go wrong here. We would go back and stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: sdsuindian
Reviews.Content: Searched many places for Bride to stay night before wedding and us to stay night of wedding. We were looking for a nice room that would not break the bank, as we had already spent a lot on the honeymoon. Got a 1 bedroom, and Room was spacious enough for bride and 4 bridesmaids to get ready in. Had a small bathroom and a kitchen. Remember, the place is rather old, and it looks it, but that adds to its charm. Beautiful lobby, and It is fairly centrally located, close to zoo, balboa park and short ride to downtown. I have lived in SD my whole life and never noticed this place. It really is a hidden gem, and a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Park Manor Suites”
Reviews.Author: Ladyonthego75
Reviews.Content: Park Manor is an older property located adjacent to Balboa Park. The staff is welcoming, gracious, and accommodating. The local patrons in the bar/restaurant were also friendly. The complimentary breakfast served at the rooftop fulfilling. We enjoyed the young families who were also guests at the hotel. My husband and I were very pleased to have found Park Manor. When in the area again, we plan to have Lunch at the Top.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: m44
Reviews.Content: All rooms are suites, i.e., you can relax in a comfortable room, enjoy those leftovers or more to the point, purchase some foods at that nearby (relatively) Whole Foods on university. Excellent dining and cocktails in the restaurant/lounge. If you are fortunate to have Frank as your wait person, listen to his recommendations. He is a professional wait person with years of experience. Avoid the breakfast on the rooftop unless you bring your own up there and go up to enjoy the view. Nearby (a 10 block walk) are many wonderful restaurants and shopping; highly recommend KousKous, Moroccan food. The neighborhood is comfortable to walk about.

Reviews.Title: “Supereb character hotel”
Reviews.Author: olderisbetter
Reviews.Content: I searched for a hotel that was away from downtown but within easy access to everything. I booked a two bedroom suite with balcony overlooking Balboa park for two people attending a conference at the Convention Centre in mid-May. We were absolutely thrilled with this hotel on Spruce Street and 5th. The suite was a character suite (meaning that when entering the suite you could feel the 1930 ambience which we loved). Spacious rooms - two bedrooms - connecting bathroom - living room, dining room and kitchen (equiped). Television in living room and the second bedroom - ceiling fans and stand up fans as this hotel does not have airconditioning except in the restaurants of which there are two. The room comes with free continental breakfast which we enjoyed every morning on the rooftop overlooking San Diego. We wished that we had eaten at the restaurant downstairs more often as it was probably the best meal we had and the entertainment was a marvelous singer. The service was topnotch. Loved every minute we were there. There was a heat wave for the first four days but it wasn't a problem for us - no sore throats from air conditioning. The mattress was not soft enough for me but that was no different than most hotels (brought my memory foam in a bag).

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay...”
Reviews.Author: aggiemary04
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. I don't think there needs to be much updating in the room. I really enjoyed the rustic/vintage feel of the hotel. Balboa park is directly across the street. Parking is FREE unlike most California hotels and so is the continental breakfast (cereal, fresh fruit, bagels, yogurt, etc). Stay here! I got a great deal on hotels.com for buy 2 nights get the 3rd free.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: martManchester
Reviews.Content: Scored this hotel above average as it has character and the staff (except breakfast staff) are great. Hotel is old and needs to be renovated. Stayed is suite on the 6th floor which had a strange smell and we were awoken early each morning with noise from the restaurant floor boards above us. Bathroom needs updating! Suite had kitchen (straight out of the 60's), furniture in the living room was shabby chic - did not sit on the desk chair for fear of breaking it! Hotel needs updating in general - a grand olde dame I would describe it as! My partner tells me that the public toilets were dreadful (dirty and bad state of repair)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CarmichaelJan
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Great staff, very large, comfortable room, across from Balboa Park (best to see on Sunday), close to the zoo, and an easy drive to Coronado Island and the Gaslamp district. An excellent value overall.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: julias21
Reviews.Content: If you're tired of staying in boring, characterless chain hotels located just off the freeway ramp next to boring, characterless chain restaurants, next time you're in San Diego, try the Park Manor. It's a charming place built in 1926 with free parking, free breakfast, and free Wi-Fi in a real neighborhood in the heart of San Diego. Every room has a small kitchen and dining area, making it convenient for families with kids. The rooms are large and full of closet space and drawers. The beds are comfortable and, even though the building is old, everything is spotlessly clean and impeccably maintained. Our room on the third floor had a view of the harbor and the surrounding neighborhood. The staff, from the front desk to the housekeepers and maintenance people, were always friendly and helpful. A standard continental breakfast is served every morning on the top floor. The food is ordinary "free breakfast" fare -- toast, bagels, yogurt, fresh fruit, cereal -- but the view is wonderful. The hotel is within walking distance of Balboa Park and the Hillcrest neighborhood with tons of restaurants and shopping, and is an easy drive to downtown, the airport, the beaches, and all of San Diego's other tourist attractions. The only negative was a bit of street noise early every morning, but it wasn't the same as the incessant rumble of freeway traffic you'll hear at many other places. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Park Manor again and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBHOTEL40
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 3-week stay at this wonderful hotel. My room was large, contained a kitchen and living area and was very clean. I travel quite a bit for business and have stayed in all types of hotels. This was one of the best experiences I've had. The hotel is right on Balboa Park and within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. I can't wait to stay at Park Manor again!

Reviews.Title: “Hot, Mildewy, Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Dooglebug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August, 2007. The lobby was the best part of the hotel. From there, it was downhill. For the price, I expected a lot more. In reading some of the reviews on here, it seems that there are some nice rooms and some not so nice. We got a not-so-nice room. It was mildewy, hot (yes, San Diego DOES get hot sometimes--it was 89-degrees and we had a hard time sleeping!), and noisy from traffic since we had to leave the windows open or die from the heat. The beds were comfortable with clean linens, but the rest of the room was falling apart. The dining room chairs sucked you in and sagged. The front desk staff were friendly-ish (depending on who you dealt with; Robin and Joe were wonderful and the others were abrupt and acted like they were doing us a favor to get up and help us). The "deluxe" continental breakfast wasn't deluxe... just your regular cereal, bananas, apples, and hard bagels. It's close enough to Balboa Park to catch a free shuttle, but that's the only good thing about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: nomsdos
Reviews.Content: Charming, historic hotel. I selected the hotel and room for the size and location, both a good price compared to the competition. Got a 1100 sq ft two bedroom suite with a kitchen. Furnishings were wonderful, bed and bedding comfortable, however, drapes were stained and old, walls and molding old and dirty, bathroom small and in need of modern appliances throughout, so much more could be done in these rooms with a little updating. There's only one small elevator and way too much traffic - needs more. Hallways had a foul odor. Could be so much more with a little work.

Reviews.Title: “Great, older hotel - huge rooms - but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Travel222Much
Reviews.Content: Great location right by Balboa Park - Zoo is just 1 mile away. Plenty of free parking - free hi-speed internet (that slows down a little the more users that get on). The rooms are huge - older - the furniture has seen better days - the hallways are dark and dingy & a little stinky - but it feels like an old building (which is what it is) with tons of character. You'll hear the person above you walking around - there is no a/c, so if you're window is open, you'll heard the sounds of traffic - and construction at 7am. The restaurant - Inn at the Park - was odd. I was going to eat there - sat down & looked around & knew what kind of food I was in store for - so I left. There's plenty around on University Ave., so you don't have far to go for food. As for the "family friendly" thing - maybe if you're offended by people who are different from you, you should do some research before booking a hotel in Hillcrest - the gay center of San Diego. Overall a great stay and I would stay there again - I had a nice view from my room - a nice breeze from all the windows & I actually felt like a resident while staying there because it was homey & had everything I needed. I recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: karpins
Reviews.Content: We were excited about staying at this hotel at the end of our vacation after having a few bad experiences at previous hotels. When we walked in the lobby it was full drunk men. The front desk attendant was friendly. We were instructed that we should take the stairs to our room on the 4th floor instead of taking the elevator because of the traffic from the bar. When we returned to the lobby we were surprised to find two men making out in the tourist brochure area. I would not say that this hotel is family friendly. The hotel should make sure that guests booking rooms in this hotel are made aware that they cater to the gay community. Due to our experience in the hotel lobby, we were uncomfortable for the rest of our stay and avoided being at the hotel as much as possible. When we booked the king sized room, it was advertised that there would be a breakfast buffet. I would call this a continental breakfast based on the selection of cereal, fruit, danishes, and bagels.. i.e. there was not sausage, bacon, eggs, waffles, or pancakes. The room was spacious and was a good value. However, it was a little outdated because of the kitchen, small tv, musty smell in hallways, and cracks along bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel- a must if in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sureLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in excellent location near Balboa park and Hillcrest. The staff are great- the piano bar is very friendly and the rooms are amazingly large, clean and airy. I will not stay anywhere else if in SAn Diego again

Reviews.Title: “What a get-away!”
Reviews.Author: DissectingDanny
Reviews.Content: Our plan was to arrive early Friday morning, we were attending a wedding later that afternoon, we were hoping to have a room ready prior to the wedding where we could shower and get dressed and not inconvenience our friends staying elsewhere with their kids. Upon arriving on Friday morning, we picked up our car from FOX Rentals, my advice go elsewhere. Very unprofessional staff and the cars weren't very clean and not in the best of conditions. Not to mention the hidden price of the rental at the end... but that's beside the point... lets talk the hotel. I had previously called and requested an early check-in, each time we were told to call the day of, but there weren't any guarantees. Working in the hospitality industry for over ten years I completely understood. Within minutes of arriving and calling, we received a call back letting us know that there was a room available right away. After breakfast with the friends and their kids we checked in... Now the photos online do not do the hotel justice. A hotel built nearly 100yrs ago was dilapidated apartment building transformed into a kitschy, luxurious and affordable hotel during the 70's. The sturdy brick building eased my west coast fears of earthquakes. The interior was very beautiful without being over done like most resorts/hotels. The fact that the hotel featured real antiques and not the cheesy replicas I've seen in plast-disney Orlando really provided a sense of class to this hotel. The staff in the tiny front desk was very courteous and helpful, providing us with ample information regarding the hotel's amenities and sites. Once we were in our room it felt like I was in an old apartment, which believe it or not made it homier. Granted, some of the decor could've been a little more updated, but this whole look was a nice change to the major chains I had been accustomed to. The kitchenette was a nice feature of which we would've gladly taken advantage of a little more than we did if we had stayed longer. One thing that did scare me when booking was the lack of a/c in the room - turns out it wasn't even needed! The San Diego weather was beyond perfect, windows open and the ceiling fan set on low was all that we needed! The room was plenty big, the closet was massive and the bathroom was a great size for two. We sadly never ate in their restaurant or got a chance to check out the live entertainment. We did take advantage of the FREE breakfast on the rooftop taking in the views of the bay, balboa parks and the mountains behind the park. The price for the room was very fair; the price for the views, convenience of walking everywhere and short rides to the major interstates and airport was beyond a steal. We plan on making San Diego and the Park Manor Suites an annual trip from now on! Small negatives to the place, the construction right next door, luckily that ended that Friday afternoon. The parking situation was alright until we arrived late Friday night after the wedding and realized the parking lot was full. We were lucky enough to find a spot right in front of the hotel. In the end, we had the choice of staying at the Park Manor Suites or the Sheraton Marina (which we found an amazing deal on), but we had opted for the Park Manor for all the right reasons and in the end we made the right choice!

Reviews.Title: “Park Manor Suites--Bigger than my first apartment”
Reviews.Author: 3badboysAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I feel compelled to bring this hotel to the attention of parents who can often be crammed into a tiny room with two or more children. We returned from a spring break trip in San Diego. I had searched this forum for information prior to the trip. We wanted a location close to Balboa Park for the beginning of the trip. We spent 3 nights at the Park Manor Suites and were delighted. We chose a one bedroom suite with a murphy bed. The room is more like a small apartment: small kitchen, dining room, large living room, a connecting bathroom/vanity/closet area and a separate queen sized bedroom. This is an old building, and there are signs of that (plaster walls, older bath fixtures,etc.). The bedding is new (I checked after the bed bugs comment posted here--must be sour grapes about something else!). But it was clean and large! Larger than my first apartment for $170 a night on Hotels.com. It is in the Hillcrest community with tons of shopping and restaurants. We at at Corvettes and Hash House a Go-Go, but there are dozens of restaurants. A continental breakfast on the rooftop is included in the price. They had a variety of bagels, toast, sweet rolls, roll, cereal, etc. The parking is free. I didn't realize what a big deal this was until I went to our next location in SD and paid $20 per day. There is no business center, but if you bring your laptop, they have free wireless connectivity in the room. There is a Kinko's nearby if you need to check messages. We never cooked, but if you want to, you could here. There is a full size refrigerator. We spent the next three nights at the Hotel Del Coranado in a room 1/3 the size and double the price. That is a lovely place, but the Park Manor Suites was an excellent find that I would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...needs some updating.”
Reviews.Author: aznate27
Reviews.Content: I recently took a trip to LA to visit friends and four of us decided to take an overnight trip to San Diego. I found the Park Manor off a website link and decided to book a room for us. It's a great hotel in an even better location, right across the street from Balboa Park, and if you don't mind the walk, about 4 blocks, not too far from Hillcrest and some of the restaurants and shops around there. We booked a 2 bedroom suite for $275. Not bad at all considering it was 1100 square feet. It was very clean and being on the fifth floor, had some great views. The two beds were both king size and VERY comfortable! I actually slept on the couch in the living room which was almost just as comfortable, I slept very well. It had a small dining table and full kitchen, which had plates, glasses, and everything you need if you wanted to cook in the room, which we did. The bathroom was clean with a HUGE tub. The only complaint I would have is that the rooms could use some updating. The bathroom looked like it had an old toilet (although very clean) and the sink was old as well. The shower head needed to be replaced as well. The suite could also do well with a new coat of paint, it was cracked and peeling in some places. I also had a difficult time connecting to the free wireless internet due to a weak signal. Other than that, it's a nice hotel. I would stay here again, although not durring the high season which is summer. I checked, the prices were a bit steep for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven Quality - large rooms, poorly equipped kitchen”
Reviews.Author: CulturedBoomer
Reviews.Content: Ensure that you ask for a room away from the construction site (March 2007) - we paid extra for a balcony that turned over to overlook a worksite and were woken early every morning! We booked this hotel specifically for the "fully equipped kitchen" and were disappointed. Vintage range without instructions, no equipment for oven cooking, not enough plug-ins (unplug fridge to use coffee maker). No cutting board, wine glasses and other essentials and very little countertop space. Staff were friendly, and did supply a few things when asked. Good location for exploring Balboa Park. Everything in the suite was a bit tatty and drapes were unclean. Comfortable bed was the best feature. Room was hot even in March.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Comfortable and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: seumas54
Reviews.Content: The Park Manor Suites is lovely, old and charming. I found it to be a delightful experience. The location is the best in San Diego. It is between two major streets with easy access to the expressway, Balboa Park and to downtown harbor attractions. The views from the rooftop are stunning. If you go to this hotel expecting new and modern accomodations, then you will be disappointed, but if you, as I do, enjoy the ambiance of a 1920's hotel then you will have great time here. The bathrooms could use some upgrading and are small, but functional. The mattresses are definately on the firm side, but not uncomfortable. The kitchen and dining room are more than adequate and the living room is large and spacious, with plenty of seating room. There are plenty of closets. The area is safe and easy to walk. We walked to dinner and back most nights at some of the restaurants in Hillcrest. The breakfast was generous with a nice view of the city. Although the parking lot is small, I had no problem parking each time I returned to the hotel. The bar is very small and delightful with a live piano player an singer almost every night. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant, because I am into trying the variety around town, but the restaurant is adjacent to the bar and seemed to be very nice as well. On Friday evenings there is a rooftop gay coctail party from 5 until 10 pm. Happy Hour prices are very low and the crowd is very enthusiastic. It is one of the most enjoyable events I have attended. San Diego's gay community has it together and they are very friendly and welcoming. I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed the Park Manor Suites. I have traveled all over the world and seldomly do I find a place more confortable or welcoming than is San Diego and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: cyclesrfun
Reviews.Content: The Park Manor has bed bugs! I was bitten hundreds of time and had to take steriods for quite a while, plus many costly creams to eliminate the bites. I also reported it to them in a very kind manner and was told they simply do not have a bedbug problem end of story. I still have the very itchy bites 3 weeks later and want to protect others from the Park Manor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: libbysmom31
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the Park Manor. Staff -- especially Shawn and Joseph -- went above and beyond the call of duty, from carrying our bags to the room while we were away at lunch to running to down the street to 7-11 to hail us a cab. The suite was plenty large enough for three over-packed adults and the view from the balcony offered an amazing cross-section of San Diego's best views (the Bay, downtown skyline and Balboa Park). Free breakfast every morning at the rooftop restaurant was fresh and offered the best coffee we had anywhere in town. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for accommodations with more character than you'll find at the big chain hotels. A Marriott looks like a Marriott whether you're in SIngapore or St. Louis. Why not try the local flavor?

Reviews.Title: “Historic Ambiance - Modern Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Wishin2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights and were delighted with our hotel choice. The staff was very polite, helpful and friendly. We loved the elegant ambiance: marble floors, gilt mirrors, crown mouldings, etc. The kingsize bed was very comfortable with a thick mattress, lots of pillows and a nice plush comforter. We used the full kitchen and dining room quite a bit and saved a lot on meals. I was a little concerned that there was no a/c, but with windows that actually opened, high ceilings and a ceiling fan, none was needed. The location overlooking Balboa Park and about eight blocks from the Hillcrest shopping/dining area was very convenient. Everything was clean and the housekeeping service was very good. The bathroom was antiquated, but everything worked just fine. The huge bath towels and English toiletries provided were a nice surprise. There was a dressing area, vanity and walk-in closet with lots of space. This hotel gives a lot of value: Large comfortable suites, free parking, free wi-fi, and continental breakfast with a breathtaking view are all included in the rate which was very reasonable for the San Diego area. We'll certainly be staying there again on our next visit and will recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DebbieKY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like a step in the past. If you want new and ultra modern, stay somewhere else but if you want style and friendly service, stay here. My sister and I just spent three nights in this great hotel. We arrived Saturday late afternoon tired and irritable from a very eventful day in different airports. We found the front desk Very friendly and helpful. When I asked for a room with a view, they apologized and informed me the hotel was full but they would take care of it the next day. Although they couldn't help with the room, a free bottle of wine helped us over our disappointment. Sure enough Sunday mid morning, we were given the keys to our upgraded room. The rooms are great. Very large and clean with a nice size kitchen. The hotel is located right across the street from Balboa park and within walking distance of a Rite Aid drugstore and dozens of restaurants. My sister and I hit the Whole Foods grocery store about a mile from the hotel (we walked). They have not only a great deli but many appealing prepacked meals to go. The hotel parking lot is small but found the side streets often available. My only complaint is the beds have no headboards... makes sitting up in bed an exercise in pillow retrievel. A great hotel, very good and friendly service throughout our entire stay and overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A welcomed Relief!”
Reviews.Author: 2bamboo
Reviews.Content: After a nightmarish stay at a local budget Hotel, in a room we named the cubicle, we called the Park Manor Suites to see if they could help rescue us during our one week stay in San Diego. Our family of five could have been a promotional video as we walked in to the suite and uttered a collective sigh of relief. As I admired the complete and full sized kitchen and the kids sunk in to the comfortable furniture, my husband marveled at the fact that the windows actually opened. The suite was huge, as hotel rooms go. The separate bedroom alone was larger than our previous hotel room. Some reviewers have complained about the plumbing and such but, heck, it's a hundred years old! Personally, we loved the old world ambiance and imagined the buggies pulling up in front and unloading their steamer trunks. Aspects that might seem distasteful or in disrepair in newer hotels gave this hotel it's character. We easily cooked all our meals in the kitchen, saving big bucks for a family. The maid service was impecable, even putting away our dishes that were left out to dry and arranging our children's stuffed animals on their beds. The location was perfect for Sea World and the Zoo. We loved the hotel so much that we often returned during our excursions to relax and have something to eat, then went back out in the evening. In the mornings the kids raided the free continental breakfast and returned to the room with their food to watch TV while my husband and I enjoyed the terrace....alone!! There is no doubt we will stay at the Park Manor the next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “You MUST Stay at the Park Manor”
Reviews.Author: Therblig
Reviews.Content: My friends and family say that I have an uncanny knack of finding the unusual and elegant at bargain prices, but when I checked into the Park Manor Suites Hotel in San Diego, I discovered that I had really outdone myself this time. Before I left Austin, Texas, I called the hotel to make certain that the accommodations were going to suit my needs. Kelli, an extremely amiable front desk clerk, listened very carefully to my requests, and I was later shocked to find that my expectations were far below the wonderful reality that she had waiting for me. Built in the mid-1920s, the hotel is adjacent to Balboa Park, and reflects the elegance of the era. Great care has been taken to preserve the art-deco European style of the establishment, and it abounds with large gilt mirrors, marble floors, bronze statues, and period furniture. The roof has a restaurant, whose atmosphere is reminiscent of the Queen Mary, with cuisine to rival. The entire rooftop, surrounded with twinkling lights, is dedicated to the gourmand, and has a happy hour every Friday night, whose local and tourist/sightseeing clientele understands the meaning of fun, food, acceptable behaviour, and value. The rooftop restaurant provides a charming Continental breakfast every morning for guests, and ground floor has a pub open daily to the public. My room looked like something from a 'Travel Europe in Style' guide book. I had chosen a mini-suite with two double beds; but was amazed to find - in addition to a bed-sitting room - a full kitchen, a dining room, and a dressing room with a gigantic mirrored double-closet, dresser, dressing table, and an ironing board with iron. I must have taken 6 baths in 2 days in the oversized bathroom tub, soaking up to my neck in total relaxation. (And believe me, after the stress of the trip there and the impending functions I had to attend, I needed it!) Dwight, the front-desk guest services manager, was attuned to my every need, and greeted me by name, as does the rest of the staff with all guests. The perfect man for the position he holds, he personally insured that every possible accommodation be made to make my stay at the Park Manor as comfortable as possible. Area maps are available at the front desk, in order to provide guests with directions to personal rendezvous' or to nearby services. My reason for being in San Diego was to attend my son's wedding at the Japanese Friendship Garden in Balboa Park; but, to be honest, the Park Manor has given me reason to go back to San Diego... period. My friends and relatives, after seeing my hotel and my room, were horrified to think about what they were enduring at more well-know establishments (and paying more) when they could have stayed at the Park Manor, dined, relaxed, slept in luxurious comfort, AND have paid considerably less. I would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a truly unique experience. This is not a cookie-cutter 'knock-off,' nor is it a 'trendy-for-now' establishment. After traveling all around the world (literally), I can honestly say that the Park Manor is the 'real thing', making a statement of its own, and making it well. While you're there, take advantage of a moment or two to chat with Kelli and Dwight, two of the most delightful hotel service people that I have ever met. J.C. Sandmann, MBA

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a cookie cutter type property”
Reviews.Author: isles_123
Reviews.Content: One night stay on a Monday in August 2006. I booked the Midweek Getaway through the "Specials" link on the hotel's website for $149 plus tax which incluses a Studio Suite, wine or champagne upon arrival in your room and $40 towards dinner at the hotel's restaurant downstairs. Champagne tasted cheap and the hotel restaurant is maybe a 2 or 3-star establishment with 4-star prices. I arrived very early (8am). The hotel staff was happy to hold my luggage and provide me with a parking permit for their lot while I spent the day in Balboa Park and the Zoo. I got lucky and there was one open space in the small lot when I arrived. Still, free parking is a great plus considering downtown hotels charge $20-30 a day to park. Check-in is the standard 3pm, but I was given a bit of a cold shoulder when I returned at 2:30pm and asked for my room. I was told it was still too early, but they gave me the room anyway. Not exactly sure why, but I was given a two-bedroom suite on the 6th floor instead of the studio I had booked. This was a pleasant surprise. I had asked for a room overlooking 6th Avenue since there is construction on the south side of the property near the parking lot, but was told all rooms had already been assigned. My room overlooked the parking lot and Spruce Street. Construction was not an issue since we checked in as the crew was ending for the day and left early the next morning. Anyway, the room was a huge, corner unit. Everything was very clean, and although there is no A/C in the hotel rooms, the corner gave great cross-ventilation so sleeping with the windows open with ocean breeze was excellent. The plumbing is a bit whacky; my toilet either did not flush or it flushed 5-10 times on its own. Water pressure in the shower is fine. Not much shelf or counter space for toiletries so we had to use a table that was just outside the bathroom door. The kitchen was a nice perk, but we only used the fridge. I suppose if we had stayed longer, we would have cooked meals to save money. My major complaint was that in the hallway near our room there were 5 or 6 drop cloths that remained there just until we were bringing our bags down to check-out. There was no one working in the hallway that I had noticed. Before you leave, be sure to go up to the 7th floor and have your free continental breakfast. The breakfast is nothing special (bagels, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee) but the view is spectacular. If I had the option, I would give this place a 3.5, but it just does not make it to a 4. The property has a lot of character and does not appear to need major renovations, but as you walk throughout the building and your room, you can see that whomever was in charge of painting did not pay much attention to detail. The windows do not move easily and the reception on both the TVs in our room was horrible. The rooms did have a bit of a musty odor, and if you are a neat freak, you may get a bit of a dirty feeling. If you lack patience and do not have your bags with you, take the stairs as an average wait for the elevator was at least 2 - 4 minutes. This is not a Hilton, nor did I expect one. For what I paid and for what I was given, I would recommend this hotel, especially if the Zoo is on your itinerary. If downtown and the marina is more your cup of tea, I suggest you find a hotel in that area since you are looking at a 15 minute cab ride (or take the 25 downtown the the Orange or Blue Trolley lines). P.S. Normally I would not address an issue like this since, to me, it is a moot point: Hillcrest is apparently a gay community. Some have complained about this hotel and its relationship with that community. Personally, I have no idea what they are talking about. We walked around extensively: in the Park, on University Avenue and all the way down 6th to the hotel. Now, perhaps because I have lived in the NY metro area my entire life I have become desensitized to things like this, but even so, there was nothing over the top going on in the hotel or the immediate area. Perhaps that is not the case on the weekends, but I certainly cannot confirm an "concerns" that have been expressed here.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky”
Reviews.Author: TX_Carolyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on June 20 and 21, 2006 - 2 adults / 2 children ages 4 & 6 years. Call hotel for any directions. Don't depend on any online direction sites. Quirky hotel. Parking lot is tiny. Staff okay. Hallways dark. Lobby golden chic. Elevator not accessible from lobby, you need to go up about 3 steps and down the hall - not that convenient. Junior Suite was lovely. Beds comfortable. Placed in front of the windows without headboards. Kids kept loosing their pillows throughtout the night. Room is large enough that the kids had extra space to play. Lots of closet space. Seperate kitchen area with a gas stove. Knobs on stove should be replaced - all worn. Make sure you pack some paper towels if you plan to cook. They only supply you with one towel and some dish soap. Kitchen cabinets smells musty when opened. Convenient store across the street. Bathroom plumbing is awful. Toilet needs to be flushed several times. Tub drains very slowly. Blinds do not close completely. Hotel directly across the street from Balboa Park and has a play ground area for kids right at the corner. Very convenient. Hotel was memorable because it wasn't a chain hotel and had personality. I would stay again especially if I wanted to go to the Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome once again”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Park, it was under renovation last time and a bit noisy and inconvenient. Seems to be done this time and I thouroughly enjoyed my stay once again. Linens are new, pillows are almost too plentiful, carpet and paint is new. Furnishings are a mix of new and old but all fit the character of the property. Request a room on the street side of the hotel due to the building going up on the back side. Also as someone previously stated there is no AC. I slept with the windows open and enjoyed it, nothing like the cool breeze coming in from the ocean at night, and really, it just isnt that hot in San Diego. Much like the old buildings in San Francisco there just isnt a need for AC. Others have stated thier 'uncomfortability' with the gay aspect of the hotel and the Hillcrest district in general, however on both of my stays I came in contact with a great many europeans and families staying there. While Hillcrest is gay I never saw anything overtly gay, disturbing or crass. If just the 'idea' of gay bothers you then you probably should not travel at all. If you are looking for the Four Seasons go elsewhere, if cool, funky, hip boutique hotels are your style book here, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon thanks to the Park and its staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Monday night, 6,000 miles and a car trip we arrive at our destination to be greeted by Doug with a friendly smile and speedy check in. The two bedroom suite we w ere given was inviting and very large and very clean. The hotel had character and charm that would not be found in any large modern hotel no matter how much they would try or spend in achieving this. The staff were very helpful and Doug and his crew could not have done more to make our stay the success it was (even down to parking our car into a tight space late at night). Housekeeping were very thorough in their job without being invasive if we chose to be in our room when they came. We would recommend this hotel to all looking for a home from home (with the butler thrown in) and will be back ourselves once we get over the jet lag.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ideal "Home Away From Home"”
Reviews.Author: Travis D
Reviews.Content: Though I understand the previous posters point that the Park Manor has charm, I'd say that the actual "charm" happens in all the wrong places. That there's a nice and funky lobby with some amazing artistic featurettes and a cute patio with a coy boy, or the spacious rooms with a hodgepodge of furniture and beautiful molding on the walls that seems to go nowhere - yes, charming. But the areas in which the Park Manor falls short is undoubtedly the overall cleanliness of the hotel. Carpets are worn and look dirty - not even like most hotels where the carpet is a busy design to avoid looking filthy. The bed linens give off the impression - and later prove to be - uncomfortable and leave you with that "dirty" feeling. I couldn't even force myself to sit on the sofa in the room wondering how many people had utilized it, knowing that the covers had probably never been washed. The television in the room was all of 19" and could only be seen from the bed with a telescope - something not provided by the hotel. I like the idea of the Park Manor. The large space is night and there could be a really friendly atmosphere in the wonderfully old building - but for $139/night I would at the very least like a bathroom that I can get clean in (rather than feeling dirtier after using it) and a bed that doesn't make me itch. But maybe that's just me... Also - the fact that they're constructing a huge new development on the backside of the Park Manor (I was here on June 13, 2006 for 2 nights and there's still A LOT of work to be done on this new project) and begin at 7am every morning is VERY lound and most annoying. BE WARNED.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Manor - more like a home than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reviewers who complained about the gently worn but character-filled apartments in the Park Manor have obviously never even seen a pre-war Manhattan apartment or wouldn't recognize its charms if they had. We have stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels around th world, yet the Park remains one of our all-time favorite hotels. Are the bathrooms glittering, noveau riche throne rooms ? Heck no! Go stay in a Marriott (or an Omni, one reviewer's soulless but no doubt sparkling alternative) if you want an antiseptic tourist's taste of the town. But if you want to feel like you have a real home away from home in San Diego, you won't find one with a better location, staff or restaurant than the Park Manor. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: What a great location - right next to the park, minutes from the freeway, Mission Valley and the harbour. The place is being refurbished, but other than sharing the elevator with workmen, it didn't affect our stay. We had booked the midweek getaway - $149 per night including $40 towards dinner on one night - which proved good value. On arrival we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite with balcony. The balcony only looked over the parking lot as we were on a low floor, but the views higher would have been spectacular. A quirky place which people will love or hate.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was one of about 18 people who were to stay at the Park Manor for a wedding. As guests were arriving, we discovered something had gone wrong with reservations and only three rooms had been held. The bridal party (including me) stayed, everyone one else found other hotels. The rooms were shabby, things were in disrepair, and the place had a slightly musty smell. Some members of the party were so disgusted that they immediatly sought other accomodations. One woman went out and bought new sheets to put on her bed. In my room, the shower was stained, the enamel was wearing off the toilet, and the sofa made me itch. In another room the refrigerator didn't work and there was a dead bug inside; there was a hole in someone else's wall. Two of the rooms were 1 BR suites, which we thought could accomodate four bridesmaids each. However, the sofa in the living room was NOT a sofa bed. So two of us shared the king bed, one took the sofa, one took the floor. One of our rooms was a studio, which came with two double beds and cost $50 less than the useless suite. The next day, all of us who had stayed at the Park Manor checked out and moved to a simple, generic low-end chain in the suburbs. People were so happy with the move that you'd think it was the Ritz. The bride was dismayed because she had been shown charming rooms when selecting this hotel for her guests. I suspect that some rooms have been renovated, and the ones we got were not. (That would also explain the good reviews below.) If you insist on staying here, reserve a refurbished room and get that promise in writing! The location was great for tourists -- right across from Balboa Park. You could walk to the Zoo (about 1/4 mi). There was a free continental breakfast in the restaurant downstairs (not on the roof, as stated in the hotel's directory). The staff was polite and friendly, and there was a lively gay bar on the roof. When the bar is hopping there is a line for the hotel's only elevator (guests can show their key cards to cut to the front of the line). Some members of our group were dismayed that the hotel was gay-friendly, so if you are homophobic don't stay here on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a class in San Diego and couldn't locate a hotel for my friend and I. After finding that all of the half-way decent hotels were booked or terribly expensive, I came across The Park Manor Hotel and Suites. I am very particular so I am careful about hotels because staying in a dump is just not something I'll do. I love old European hotels and places with character and the Park Manor fit right into that description. At the present time they are involved with a huge expensive renovation of the upper story and part of the restaurant and bar. I guess the rooms come next, but my friend and I were so happy with our accomodations that if they never renovated the rooms they'd be fine. For under $200.00 we were given a two bedroom suite with living room, dining room and kitchen (1100 sq. ft.) with a continental breakfast each morning. Yes, this is a shabby chic place, so if you expect perfection you'll be unhappy. But waking up every morning in my giant bed and watching the sheer curtains gently wave in the breeze from the open French doors onto the balcony (did I mention the view of Balboa Park?) was worth a few scrapes and chips. The room was immaculately clean and housekeeping was efficient. The restaurant is excellent, very 'old world' with white tablecloths and a palette cleanser between courses. Our dinners were excellent except for a tasty but too dry cornish game hen on the first night. There is a large gay client base at this hotel so if you are homo-phobic you'll be unhappy, but there are other patrons as well; men, women, and children who also stay there and appear to be quite content. Friday night is 'happy hour' and I don't think I've ever seen people so--well, HAPPY. I love this hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Inn at the Park
HotelInfo.Address: 525 Spruce Street, San Diego, CA 92103 (Formerly Park Manor Suites)
